verses.name: Numbers 1:1
verses.text: The LORD spoke to Moses in the Tent of Meeting in the Desert of Sinai on the first day of the second month of the second year after the Israelites came out of Egypt. He said:

verses.name: Numbers 1:2
verses.text: "Take a census of the whole Israelite community by their clans and families, listing every man by name, one by one.

verses.name: Numbers 1:3
verses.text: You and Aaron are to number by their divisions all the men in Israel twenty years old or more who are able to serve in the army.

verses.name: Numbers 1:4
verses.text: One man from each tribe, each the head of his family, is to help you.

verses.name: Numbers 1:5
verses.text: These are the names of the men who are to assist you: from Reuben, Elizur son of Shedeur;

verses.name: Numbers 1:6
verses.text: from Simeon, Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai;

verses.name: Numbers 1:7
verses.text: from Judah, Nahshon son of Amminadab;

verses.name: Numbers 1:8
verses.text: from Issachar, Nethanel son of Zuar;

verses.name: Numbers 1:9
verses.text: from Zebulun, Eliab son of Helon;

verses.name: Numbers 1:10
verses.text: from the sons of Joseph: from Ephraim, Elishama son of Ammihud; from Manasseh, Gamaliel son of Pedahzur;

verses.name: Numbers 1:11
verses.text: from Benjamin, Abidan son of Gideoni;

verses.name: Numbers 1:12
verses.text: from Dan, Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai;

verses.name: Numbers 1:13
verses.text: from Asher, Pagiel son of Ocran;

verses.name: Numbers 1:14
verses.text: from Gad, Eliasaph son of Deuel;

verses.name: Numbers 1:15
verses.text: from Naphtali, Ahira son of Enan."

verses.name: Numbers 1:16
verses.text: These were the men appointed from the community, the leaders of their ancestral tribes. They were the heads of the clans of Israel.

verses.name: Numbers 1:17
verses.text: Moses and Aaron took these men whose names had been given,

verses.name: Numbers 1:18
verses.text: and they called the whole community together on the first day of the second month. The people indicated their ancestry by their clans and families, and the men twenty years old or more were listed by name, one by one,

verses.name: Numbers 1:19
verses.text: as the LORD commanded Moses. And so he counted them in the Desert of Sinai:

verses.name: Numbers 1:20
verses.text: From the descendants of Reuben the firstborn son of Israel: All the men twenty years old or more who were able to serve in the army were listed by name, one by one, according to the records of their clans and families.

verses.name: Numbers 1:21
verses.text: The number from the tribe of Reuben was 46,500.

verses.name: Numbers 1:22
verses.text: From the descendants of Simeon: All the men twenty years old or more who were able to serve in the army were counted and listed by name, one by one, according to the records of their clans and families.

verses.name: Numbers 1:23
verses.text: The number from the tribe of Simeon was 59,300.

verses.name: Numbers 1:24
verses.text: From the descendants of Gad: All the men twenty years old or more who were able to serve in the army were listed by name, according to the records of their clans and families.

verses.name: Numbers 1:25
verses.text: The number from the tribe of Gad was 45,650.

verses.name: Numbers 1:26
verses.text: From the descendants of Judah: All the men twenty years old or more who were able to serve in the army were listed by name, according to the records of their clans and families.

verses.name: Numbers 1:27
verses.text: The number from the tribe of Judah was 74,600.

verses.name: Numbers 1:28
verses.text: From the descendants of Issachar: All the men twenty years old or more who were able to serve in the army were listed by name, according to the records of their clans and families.

verses.name: Numbers 1:29
verses.text: The number from the tribe of Issachar was 54,400.

verses.name: Numbers 1:30
verses.text: From the descendants of Zebulun: All the men twenty years old or more who were able to serve in the army were listed by name, according to the records of their clans and families.

verses.name: Numbers 1:31
verses.text: The number from the tribe of Zebulun was 57,400.

verses.name: Numbers 1:32
verses.text: From the sons of Joseph: From the descendants of Ephraim: All the men twenty years old or more who were able to serve in the army were listed by name, according to the records of their clans and families.

verses.name: Numbers 1:33
verses.text: The number from the tribe of Ephraim was 40,500.

verses.name: Numbers 1:34
verses.text: From the descendants of Manasseh: All the men twenty years old or more who were able to serve in the army were listed by name, according to the records of their clans and families.

verses.name: Numbers 1:35
verses.text: The number from the tribe of Manasseh was 32,200.

verses.name: Numbers 1:36
verses.text: From the descendants of Benjamin: All the men twenty years old or more who were able to serve in the army were listed by name, according to the records of their clans and families.

verses.name: Numbers 1:37
verses.text: The number from the tribe of Benjamin was 35,400.

verses.name: Numbers 1:38
verses.text: From the descendants of Dan: All the men twenty years old or more who were able to serve in the army were listed by name, according to the records of their clans and families.

verses.name: Numbers 1:39
verses.text: The number from the tribe of Dan was 62,700.

verses.name: Numbers 1:40
verses.text: From the descendants of Asher: All the men twenty years old or more who were able to serve in the army were listed by name, according to the records of their clans and families.

verses.name: Numbers 1:41
verses.text: The number from the tribe of Asher was 41,500.

verses.name: Numbers 1:42
verses.text: From the descendants of Naphtali: All the men twenty years old or more who were able to serve in the army were listed by name, according to the records of their clans and families.

verses.name: Numbers 1:43
verses.text: The number from the tribe of Naphtali was 53,400.

verses.name: Numbers 1:44
verses.text: These were the men counted by Moses and Aaron and the twelve leaders of Israel, each one representing his family.

verses.name: Numbers 1:45
verses.text: All the Israelites twenty years old or more who were able to serve in Israel's army were counted according to their families.

verses.name: Numbers 1:46
verses.text: The total number was 603,550.

verses.name: Numbers 1:47
verses.text: The families of the tribe of Levi, however, were not counted along with the others.

verses.name: Numbers 1:48
verses.text: The LORD had said to Moses:

verses.name: Numbers 1:49
verses.text: "You must not count the tribe of Levi or include them in the census of the other Israelites.

verses.name: Numbers 1:50
verses.text: Instead, appoint the Levites to be in charge of the tabernacle of the Testimony-over all its furnishings and everything belonging to it. They are to carry the tabernacle and all its furnishings; they are to take care of it and encamp around it.

verses.name: Numbers 1:51
verses.text: Whenever the tabernacle is to move, the Levites are to take it down, and whenever the tabernacle is to be set up, the Levites shall do it. Anyone else who goes near it shall be put to death.

verses.name: Numbers 1:52
verses.text: The Israelites are to set up their tents by divisions, each man in his own camp under his own standard.

verses.name: Numbers 1:53
verses.text: The Levites, however, are to set up their tents around the tabernacle of the Testimony so that wrath will not fall on the Israelite community. The Levites are to be responsible for the care of the tabernacle of the Testimony."

verses.name: Numbers 1:54
verses.text: The Israelites did all this just as the LORD commanded Moses.

verses.name: Numbers 2:1
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses and Aaron:

verses.name: Numbers 2:2
verses.text: "The Israelites are to camp around the Tent of Meeting some distance from it, each man under his standard with the banners of his family."

verses.name: Numbers 2:3
verses.text: On the east, toward the sunrise, the divisions of the camp of Judah are to encamp under their standard. The leader of the people of Judah is Nahshon son of Amminadab.

verses.name: Numbers 2:4
verses.text: His division numbers 74,600.

verses.name: Numbers 2:5
verses.text: The tribe of Issachar will camp next to them. The leader of the people of Issachar is Nethanel son of Zuar.

verses.name: Numbers 2:6
verses.text: His division numbers 54,400.

verses.name: Numbers 2:7
verses.text: The tribe of Zebulun will be next. The leader of the people of Zebulun is Eliab son of Helon.

verses.name: Numbers 2:8
verses.text: His division numbers 57,400.

verses.name: Numbers 2:9
verses.text: All the men assigned to the camp of Judah, according to their divisions, number 186,400. They will set out first.

verses.name: Numbers 2:10
verses.text: On the south will be the divisions of the camp of Reuben under their standard. The leader of the people of Reuben is Elizur son of Shedeur.

verses.name: Numbers 2:11
verses.text: His division numbers 46,500.

verses.name: Numbers 2:12
verses.text: The tribe of Simeon will camp next to them. The leader of the people of Simeon is Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai.

verses.name: Numbers 2:13
verses.text: His division numbers 59,300.

verses.name: Numbers 2:14
verses.text: The tribe of Gad will be next. The leader of the people of Gad is Eliasaph son of Deuel.

verses.name: Numbers 2:15
verses.text: His division numbers 45,650.

verses.name: Numbers 2:16
verses.text: All the men assigned to the camp of Reuben, according to their divisions, number 151,450. They will set out second.

verses.name: Numbers 2:17
verses.text: Then the Tent of Meeting and the camp of the Levites will set out in the middle of the camps. They will set out in the same order as they encamp, each in his own place under his standard.

verses.name: Numbers 2:18
verses.text: On the west will be the divisions of the camp of Ephraim under their standard. The leader of the people of Ephraim is Elishama son of Ammihud.

verses.name: Numbers 2:19
verses.text: His division numbers 40,500.

verses.name: Numbers 2:20
verses.text: The tribe of Manasseh will be next to them. The leader of the people of Manasseh is Gamaliel son of Pedahzur.

verses.name: Numbers 2:21
verses.text: His division numbers 32,200.

verses.name: Numbers 2:22
verses.text: The tribe of Benjamin will be next. The leader of the people of Benjamin is Abidan son of Gideoni.

verses.name: Numbers 2:23
verses.text: His division numbers 35,400.

verses.name: Numbers 2:24
verses.text: All the men assigned to the camp of Ephraim, according to their divisions, number 108,100. They will set out third.

verses.name: Numbers 2:25
verses.text: On the north will be the divisions of the camp of Dan, under their standard. The leader of the people of Dan is Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai.

verses.name: Numbers 2:26
verses.text: His division numbers 62,700.

verses.name: Numbers 2:27
verses.text: The tribe of Asher will camp next to them. The leader of the people of Asher is Pagiel son of Ocran.

verses.name: Numbers 2:28
verses.text: His division numbers 41,500.

verses.name: Numbers 2:29
verses.text: The tribe of Naphtali will be next. The leader of the people of Naphtali is Ahira son of Enan.

verses.name: Numbers 2:30
verses.text: His division numbers 53,400.

verses.name: Numbers 2:31
verses.text: All the men assigned to the camp of Dan number 157,600. They will set out last, under their standards.

verses.name: Numbers 2:32
verses.text: These are the Israelites, counted according to their families. All those in the camps, by their divisions, number 603,550.

verses.name: Numbers 2:33
verses.text: The Levites, however, were not counted along with the other Israelites, as the LORD commanded Moses.

verses.name: Numbers 2:34
verses.text: So the Israelites did everything the LORD commanded Moses; that is the way they encamped under their standards, and that is the way they set out, each with his clan and family.

verses.name: Numbers 3:1
verses.text: This is the account of the family of Aaron and Moses at the time the LORD talked with Moses on Mount Sinai.

verses.name: Numbers 3:2
verses.text: The names of the sons of Aaron were Nadab the firstborn and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.

verses.name: Numbers 3:3
verses.text: Those were the names of Aaron's sons, the anointed priests, who were ordained to serve as priests.

verses.name: Numbers 3:4
verses.text: Nadab and Abihu, however, fell dead before the LORD when they made an offering with unauthorized fire before him in the Desert of Sinai. They had no sons; so only Eleazar and Ithamar served as priests during the lifetime of their father Aaron.

verses.name: Numbers 3:5
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses,

verses.name: Numbers 3:6
verses.text: "Bring the tribe of Levi and present them to Aaron the priest to assist him.

verses.name: Numbers 3:7
verses.text: They are to perform duties for him and for the whole community at the Tent of Meeting by doing the work of the tabernacle.

verses.name: Numbers 3:8
verses.text: They are to take care of all the furnishings of the Tent of Meeting, fulfilling the obligations of the Israelites by doing the work of the tabernacle.

verses.name: Numbers 3:9
verses.text: Give the Levites to Aaron and his sons; they are the Israelites who are to be given wholly to him.

verses.name: Numbers 3:10
verses.text: Appoint Aaron and his sons to serve as priests; anyone else who approaches the sanctuary must be put to death."

verses.name: Numbers 3:11
verses.text: The LORD also said to Moses,

verses.name: Numbers 3:12
verses.text: "I have taken the Levites from among the Israelites in place of the first male offspring of every Israelite woman. The Levites are mine,

verses.name: Numbers 3:13
verses.text: for all the firstborn are mine. When I struck down all the firstborn in Egypt, I set apart for myself every firstborn in Israel, whether man or animal. They are to be mine. I am the LORD."

verses.name: Numbers 3:14
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses in the Desert of Sinai,

verses.name: Numbers 3:15
verses.text: "Count the Levites by their families and clans. Count every male a month old or more."

verses.name: Numbers 3:16
verses.text: So Moses counted them, as he was commanded by the word of the LORD.

verses.name: Numbers 3:17
verses.text: These were the names of the sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath and Merari.

verses.name: Numbers 3:18
verses.text: These were the names of the Gershonite clans: Libni and Shimei.

verses.name: Numbers 3:19
verses.text: The Kohathite clans: Amram, Izhar, Hebron and Uzziel.

verses.name: Numbers 3:20
verses.text: The Merarite clans: Mahli and Mushi. These were the Levite clans, according to their families.

verses.name: Numbers 3:21
verses.text: To Gershon belonged the clans of the Libnites and Shimeites; these were the Gershonite clans.

verses.name: Numbers 3:22
verses.text: The number of all the males a month old or more who were counted was 7,500.

verses.name: Numbers 3:23
verses.text: The Gershonite clans were to camp on the west, behind the tabernacle.

verses.name: Numbers 3:24
verses.text: The leader of the families of the Gershonites was Eliasaph son of Lael.

verses.name: Numbers 3:25
verses.text: At the Tent of Meeting the Gershonites were responsible for the care of the tabernacle and tent, its coverings, the curtain at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting,

verses.name: Numbers 3:26
verses.text: the curtains of the courtyard, the curtain at the entrance to the courtyard surrounding the tabernacle and altar, and the ropes-and everything related to their use.

verses.name: Numbers 3:27
verses.text: To Kohath belonged the clans of the Amramites, Izharites, Hebronites and Uzzielites; these were the Kohathite clans.

verses.name: Numbers 3:28
verses.text: The number of all the males a month old or more was 8,600. The Kohathites were responsible for the care of the sanctuary.

verses.name: Numbers 3:29
verses.text: The Kohathite clans were to camp on the south side of the tabernacle.

verses.name: Numbers 3:30
verses.text: The leader of the families of the Kohathite clans was Elizaphan son of Uzziel.

verses.name: Numbers 3:31
verses.text: They were responsible for the care of the ark, the table, the lampstand, the altars, the articles of the sanctuary used in ministering, the curtain, and everything related to their use.

verses.name: Numbers 3:32
verses.text: The chief leader of the Levites was Eleazar son of Aaron, the priest. He was appointed over those who were responsible for the care of the sanctuary.

verses.name: Numbers 3:33
verses.text: To Merari belonged the clans of the Mahlites and the Mushites; these were the Merarite clans.

verses.name: Numbers 3:34
verses.text: The number of all the males a month old or more who were counted was 6,200.

verses.name: Numbers 3:35
verses.text: The leader of the families of the Merarite clans was Zuriel son of Abihail; they were to camp on the north side of the tabernacle.

verses.name: Numbers 3:36
verses.text: The Merarites were appointed to take care of the frames of the tabernacle, its crossbars, posts, bases, all its equipment, and everything related to their use,

verses.name: Numbers 3:37
verses.text: as well as the posts of the surrounding courtyard with their bases, tent pegs and ropes.

verses.name: Numbers 3:38
verses.text: Moses and Aaron and his sons were to camp to the east of the tabernacle, toward the sunrise, in front of the Tent of Meeting. They were responsible for the care of the sanctuary on behalf of the Israelites. Anyone else who approached the sanctuary was to be put to death.

verses.name: Numbers 3:39
verses.text: The total number of Levites counted at the LORD's command by Moses and Aaron according to their clans, including every male a month old or more, was 22,000.

verses.name: Numbers 3:40
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses, "Count all the firstborn Israelite males who are a month old or more and make a list of their names.

verses.name: Numbers 3:41
verses.text: Take the Levites for me in place of all the firstborn of the Israelites, and the livestock of the Levites in place of all the firstborn of the livestock of the Israelites. I am the LORD."

verses.name: Numbers 3:42
verses.text: So Moses counted all the firstborn of the Israelites, as the LORD commanded him.

verses.name: Numbers 3:43
verses.text: The total number of firstborn males a month old or more, listed by name, was 22,273.

verses.name: Numbers 3:44
verses.text: The LORD also said to Moses,

verses.name: Numbers 3:45
verses.text: "Take the Levites in place of all the firstborn of Israel, and the livestock of the Levites in place of their livestock. The Levites are to be mine. I am the LORD.

verses.name: Numbers 3:46
verses.text: To redeem the 273 firstborn Israelites who exceed the number of the Levites,

verses.name: Numbers 3:47
verses.text: collect five shekels for each one, according to the sanctuary shekel, which weighs twenty gerahs.

verses.name: Numbers 3:48
verses.text: Give the money for the redemption of the additional Israelites to Aaron and his sons."

verses.name: Numbers 3:49
verses.text: So Moses collected the redemption money from those who exceeded the number redeemed by the Levites.

verses.name: Numbers 3:50
verses.text: From the firstborn of the Israelites he collected silver weighing 1,365 shekels, according to the sanctuary shekel.

verses.name: Numbers 3:51
verses.text: Moses gave the redemption money to Aaron and his sons, as he was commanded by the word of the LORD.

verses.name: Numbers 4:1
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses and Aaron:

verses.name: Numbers 4:2
verses.text: "Take a census of the Kohathite branch of the Levites by their clans and families.

verses.name: Numbers 4:3
verses.text: Count all the men from thirty to fifty years of age who come to serve in the work in the Tent of Meeting.

verses.name: Numbers 4:4
verses.text: "This is the work of the Kohathites in the Tent of Meeting: the care of the most holy things.

verses.name: Numbers 4:5
verses.text: When the camp is to move, Aaron and his sons are to go in and take down the shielding curtain and cover the ark of the Testimony with it.

verses.name: Numbers 4:6
verses.text: Then they are to cover this with hides of sea cows, spread a cloth of solid blue over that and put the poles in place.

verses.name: Numbers 4:7
verses.text: "Over the table of the Presence they are to spread a blue cloth and put on it the plates, dishes and bowls, and the jars for drink offerings; the bread that is continually there is to remain on it.

verses.name: Numbers 4:8
verses.text: Over these they are to spread a scarlet cloth, cover that with hides of sea cows and put its poles in place.

verses.name: Numbers 4:9
verses.text: "They are to take a blue cloth and cover the lampstand that is for light, together with its lamps, its wick trimmers and trays, and all its jars for the oil used to supply it.

verses.name: Numbers 4:10
verses.text: Then they are to wrap it and all its accessories in a covering of hides of sea cows and put it on a carrying frame.

verses.name: Numbers 4:11
verses.text: "Over the gold altar they are to spread a blue cloth and cover that with hides of sea cows and put its poles in place.

verses.name: Numbers 4:12
verses.text: "They are to take all the articles used for ministering in the sanctuary, wrap them in a blue cloth, cover that with hides of sea cows and put them on a carrying frame.

verses.name: Numbers 4:13
verses.text: "They are to remove the ashes from the bronze altar and spread a purple cloth over it.

verses.name: Numbers 4:14
verses.text: Then they are to place on it all the utensils used for ministering at the altar, including the firepans, meat forks, shovels and sprinkling bowls. Over it they are to spread a covering of hides of sea cows and put its poles in place.

verses.name: Numbers 4:15
verses.text: "After Aaron and his sons have finished covering the holy furnishings and all the holy articles, and when the camp is ready to move, the Kohathites are to come to do the carrying. But they must not touch the holy things or they will die. The Kohathites are to carry those things that are in the Tent of Meeting.

verses.name: Numbers 4:16
verses.text: "Eleazar son of Aaron, the priest, is to have charge of the oil for the light, the fragrant incense, the regular grain offering and the anointing oil. He is to be in charge of the entire tabernacle and everything in it, including its holy furnishings and articles."

verses.name: Numbers 4:17
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses and Aaron,

verses.name: Numbers 4:18
verses.text: "See that the Kohathite tribal clans are not cut off from the Levites.

verses.name: Numbers 4:19
verses.text: So that they may live and not die when they come near the most holy things, do this for them: Aaron and his sons are to go into the sanctuary and assign to each man his work and what he is to carry.

verses.name: Numbers 4:20
verses.text: But the Kohathites must not go in to look at the holy things, even for a moment, or they will die."

verses.name: Numbers 4:21
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses,

verses.name: Numbers 4:22
verses.text: "Take a census also of the Gershonites by their families and clans.

verses.name: Numbers 4:23
verses.text: Count all the men from thirty to fifty years of age who come to serve in the work at the Tent of Meeting.

verses.name: Numbers 4:24
verses.text: "This is the service of the Gershonite clans as they work and carry burdens:

verses.name: Numbers 4:25
verses.text: They are to carry the curtains of the tabernacle, the Tent of Meeting, its covering and the outer covering of hides of sea cows, the curtains for the entrance to the Tent of Meeting,

verses.name: Numbers 4:26
verses.text: the curtains of the courtyard surrounding the tabernacle and altar, the curtain for the entrance, the ropes and all the equipment used in its service. The Gershonites are to do all that needs to be done with these things.

verses.name: Numbers 4:27
verses.text: All their service, whether carrying or doing other work, is to be done under the direction of Aaron and his sons. You shall assign to them as their responsibility all they are to carry.

verses.name: Numbers 4:28
verses.text: This is the service of the Gershonite clans at the Tent of Meeting. Their duties are to be under the direction of Ithamar son of Aaron, the priest.

verses.name: Numbers 4:29
verses.text: "Count the Merarites by their clans and families.

verses.name: Numbers 4:30
verses.text: Count all the men from thirty to fifty years of age who come to serve in the work at the Tent of Meeting.

verses.name: Numbers 4:31
verses.text: This is their duty as they perform service at the Tent of Meeting: to carry the frames of the tabernacle, its crossbars, posts and bases,

verses.name: Numbers 4:32
verses.text: as well as the posts of the surrounding courtyard with their bases, tent pegs, ropes, all their equipment and everything related to their use. Assign to each man the specific things he is to carry.

verses.name: Numbers 4:33
verses.text: This is the service of the Merarite clans as they work at the Tent of Meeting under the direction of Ithamar son of Aaron, the priest."

verses.name: Numbers 4:34
verses.text: Moses, Aaron and the leaders of the community counted the Kohathites by their clans and families.

verses.name: Numbers 4:35
verses.text: All the men from thirty to fifty years of age who came to serve in the work in the Tent of Meeting,

verses.name: Numbers 4:36
verses.text: counted by clans, were 2,750.

verses.name: Numbers 4:37
verses.text: This was the total of all those in the Kohathite clans who served in the Tent of Meeting. Moses and Aaron counted them according to the LORD's command through Moses.

verses.name: Numbers 4:38
verses.text: The Gershonites were counted by their clans and families.

verses.name: Numbers 4:39
verses.text: All the men from thirty to fifty years of age who came to serve in the work at the Tent of Meeting,

verses.name: Numbers 4:40
verses.text: counted by their clans and families, were 2,630.

verses.name: Numbers 4:41
verses.text: This was the total of those in the Gershonite clans who served at the Tent of Meeting. Moses and Aaron counted them according to the LORD's command.

verses.name: Numbers 4:42
verses.text: The Merarites were counted by their clans and families.

verses.name: Numbers 4:43
verses.text: All the men from thirty to fifty years of age who came to serve in the work at the Tent of Meeting,

verses.name: Numbers 4:44
verses.text: counted by their clans, were 3,200.

verses.name: Numbers 4:45
verses.text: This was the total of those in the Merarite clans. Moses and Aaron counted them according to the LORD's command through Moses.

verses.name: Numbers 4:46
verses.text: So Moses, Aaron and the leaders of Israel counted all the Levites by their clans and families.

verses.name: Numbers 4:47
verses.text: All the men from thirty to fifty years of age who came to do the work of serving and carrying the Tent of Meeting

verses.name: Numbers 4:48
verses.text: numbered 8,580.

verses.name: Numbers 4:49
verses.text: At the LORD's command through Moses, each was assigned his work and told what to carry. Thus they were counted, as the LORD commanded Moses.

verses.name: Numbers 5:1
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses,

verses.name: Numbers 5:2
verses.text: "Command the Israelites to send away from the camp anyone who has an infectious skin disease or a discharge of any kind, or who is ceremonially unclean because of a dead body.

verses.name: Numbers 5:3
verses.text: Send away male and female alike; send them outside the camp so they will not defile their camp, where I dwell among them."

verses.name: Numbers 5:4
verses.text: The Israelites did this; they sent them outside the camp. They did just as the LORD had instructed Moses.

verses.name: Numbers 5:5
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses,

verses.name: Numbers 5:6
verses.text: "Say to the Israelites: 'When a man or woman wrongs another in any way and so is unfaithful to the LORD, that person is guilty

verses.name: Numbers 5:7
verses.text: and must confess the sin he has committed. He must make full restitution for his wrong, add one fifth to it and give it all to the person he has wronged.

verses.name: Numbers 5:8
verses.text: But if that person has no close relative to whom restitution can be made for the wrong, the restitution belongs to the LORD and must be given to the priest, along with the ram with which atonement is made for him.

verses.name: Numbers 5:9
verses.text: All the sacred contributions the Israelites bring to a priest will belong to him.

verses.name: Numbers 5:10
verses.text: Each man's sacred gifts are his own, but what he gives to the priest will belong to the priest.'"

verses.name: Numbers 5:11
verses.text: Then the LORD said to Moses,

verses.name: Numbers 5:12
verses.text: "Speak to the Israelites and say to them: 'If a man's wife goes astray and is unfaithful to him

verses.name: Numbers 5:13
verses.text: by sleeping with another man, and this is hidden from her husband and her impurity is undetected (since there is no witness against her and she has not been caught in the act),

verses.name: Numbers 5:14
verses.text: and if feelings of jealousy come over her husband and he suspects his wife and she is impure-or if he is jealous and suspects her even though she is not impure-

verses.name: Numbers 5:15
verses.text: then he is to take his wife to the priest. He must also take an offering of a tenth of an ephah of barley flour on her behalf. He must not pour oil on it or put incense on it, because it is a grain offering for jealousy, a reminder offering to draw attention to guilt.

verses.name: Numbers 5:16
verses.text: "'The priest shall bring her and have her stand before the LORD.

verses.name: Numbers 5:17
verses.text: Then he shall take some holy water in a clay jar and put some dust from the tabernacle floor into the water.

verses.name: Numbers 5:18
verses.text: After the priest has had the woman stand before the LORD, he shall loosen her hair and place in her hands the reminder offering, the grain offering for jealousy, while he himself holds the bitter water that brings a curse.

verses.name: Numbers 5:19
verses.text: Then the priest shall put the woman under oath and say to her, "If no other man has slept with you and you have not gone astray and become impure while married to your husband, may this bitter water that brings a curse not harm you.

verses.name: Numbers 5:20
verses.text: But if you have gone astray while married to your husband and you have defiled yourself by sleeping with a man other than your husband"-

verses.name: Numbers 5:21
verses.text: here the priest is to put the woman under this curse of the oath-"may the LORD cause your people to curse and denounce you when he causes your thigh to waste away and your abdomen to swell.

verses.name: Numbers 5:22
verses.text: May this water that brings a curse enter your body so that your abdomen swells and your thigh wastes away.  'Then the woman is to say, "Amen. So be it."

verses.name: Numbers 5:23
verses.text: "'The priest is to write these curses on a scroll and then wash them off into the bitter water.

verses.name: Numbers 5:24
verses.text: He shall have the woman drink the bitter water that brings a curse, and this water will enter her and cause bitter suffering.

verses.name: Numbers 5:25
verses.text: The priest is to take from her hands the grain offering for jealousy, wave it before the LORD and bring it to the altar.

verses.name: Numbers 5:26
verses.text: The priest is then to take a handful of the grain offering as a memorial offering and burn it on the altar; after that, he is to have the woman drink the water.

verses.name: Numbers 5:27
verses.text: If she has defiled herself and been unfaithful to her husband, then when she is made to drink the water that brings a curse, it will go into her and cause bitter suffering; her abdomen will swell and her thigh waste away, and she will become accursed among her people.

verses.name: Numbers 5:28
verses.text: If, however, the woman has not defiled herself and is free from impurity, she will be cleared of guilt and will be able to have children.

verses.name: Numbers 5:29
verses.text: "'This, then, is the law of jealousy when a woman goes astray and defiles herself while married to her husband,

verses.name: Numbers 5:30
verses.text: or when feelings of jealousy come over a man because he suspects his wife. The priest is to have her stand before the LORD and is to apply this entire law to her.

verses.name: Numbers 5:31
verses.text: The husband will be innocent of any wrongdoing, but the woman will bear the consequences of her sin.'"

verses.name: Numbers 6:1
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses,

verses.name: Numbers 6:2
verses.text: "Speak to the Israelites and say to them: 'If a man or woman wants to make a special vow, a vow of separation to the LORD as a Nazirite,

verses.name: Numbers 6:3
verses.text: he must abstain from wine and other fermented drink and must not drink vinegar made from wine or from other fermented drink. He must not drink grape juice or eat grapes or raisins.

verses.name: Numbers 6:4
verses.text: As long as he is a Nazirite, he must not eat anything that comes from the grapevine, not even the seeds or skins.

verses.name: Numbers 6:5
verses.text: "'During the entire period of his vow of separation no razor may be used on his head. He must be holy until the period of his separation to the LORD is over; he must let the hair of his head grow long.

verses.name: Numbers 6:6
verses.text: Throughout the period of his separation to the LORD he must not go near a dead body.

verses.name: Numbers 6:7
verses.text: Even if his own father or mother or brother or sister dies, he must not make himself ceremonially unclean on account of them, because the symbol of his separation to God is on his head.

verses.name: Numbers 6:8
verses.text: Throughout the period of his separation he is consecrated to the LORD.

verses.name: Numbers 6:9
verses.text: "'If someone dies suddenly in his presence, thus defiling the hair he has dedicated, he must shave his head on the day of his cleansing-the seventh day.

verses.name: Numbers 6:10
verses.text: Then on the eighth day he must bring two doves or two young pigeons to the priest at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.

verses.name: Numbers 6:11
verses.text: The priest is to offer one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering to make atonement for him because he sinned by being in the presence of the dead body. That same day he is to consecrate his head.

verses.name: Numbers 6:12
verses.text: He must dedicate himself to the LORD for the period of his separation and must bring a year-old male lamb as a guilt offering. The previous days do not count, because he became defiled during his separation.

verses.name: Numbers 6:13
verses.text: "'Now this is the law for the Nazirite when the period of his separation is over. He is to be brought to the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.

verses.name: Numbers 6:14
verses.text: There he is to present his offerings to the LORD: a year-old male lamb without defect for a burnt offering, a year-old ewe lamb without defect for a sin offering, a ram without defect for a fellowship offering,

verses.name: Numbers 6:15
verses.text: together with their grain offerings and drink offerings, and a basket of bread made without yeast-cakes made of fine flour mixed with oil, and wafers spread with oil.

verses.name: Numbers 6:16
verses.text: "'The priest is to present them before the LORD and make the sin offering and the burnt offering.

verses.name: Numbers 6:17
verses.text: He is to present the basket of unleavened bread and is to sacrifice the ram as a fellowship offering to the LORD, together with its grain offering and drink offering.

verses.name: Numbers 6:18
verses.text: "'Then at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting, the Nazirite must shave off the hair that he dedicated. He is to take the hair and put it in the fire that is under the sacrifice of the fellowship offering.

verses.name: Numbers 6:19
verses.text: "'After the Nazirite has shaved off the hair of his dedication, the priest is to place in his hands a boiled shoulder of the ram, and a cake and a wafer from the basket, both made without yeast.

verses.name: Numbers 6:20
verses.text: The priest shall then wave them before the LORD as a wave offering; they are holy and belong to the priest, together with the breast that was waved and the thigh that was presented. After that, the Nazirite may drink wine.

verses.name: Numbers 6:21
verses.text: "'This is the law of the Nazirite who vows his offering to the LORD in accordance with his separation, in addition to whatever else he can afford. He must fulfill the vow he has made, according to the law of the Nazirite.'"

verses.name: Numbers 6:22
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses,

verses.name: Numbers 6:23
verses.text: "Tell Aaron and his sons, 'This is how you are to bless the Israelites. Say to them:

verses.name: Numbers 6:24
verses.text: "'"The LORD bless you and keep you;

verses.name: Numbers 6:25
verses.text: the LORD make his face shine upon you and be gracious to you;

verses.name: Numbers 6:26
verses.text: the LORD turn his face toward you and give you peace."'

verses.name: Numbers 6:27
verses.text: "So they will put my name on the Israelites, and I will bless them."

verses.name: Numbers 7:1
verses.text: When Moses finished setting up the tabernacle, he anointed it and consecrated it and all its furnishings. He also anointed and consecrated the altar and all its utensils.

verses.name: Numbers 7:2
verses.text: Then the leaders of Israel, the heads of families who were the tribal leaders in charge of those who were counted, made offerings.

verses.name: Numbers 7:3
verses.text: They brought as their gifts before the LORD six covered carts and twelve oxen-an ox from each leader and a cart from every two. These they presented before the tabernacle.

verses.name: Numbers 7:4
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses,

verses.name: Numbers 7:5
verses.text: "Accept these from them, that they may be used in the work at the Tent of Meeting. Give them to the Levites as each man's work requires."

verses.name: Numbers 7:6
verses.text: So Moses took the carts and oxen and gave them to the Levites.

verses.name: Numbers 7:7
verses.text: He gave two carts and four oxen to the Gershonites, as their work required,

verses.name: Numbers 7:8
verses.text: and he gave four carts and eight oxen to the Merarites, as their work required. They were all under the direction of Ithamar son of Aaron, the priest.

verses.name: Numbers 7:9
verses.text: But Moses did not give any to the Kohathites, because they were to carry on their shoulders the holy things, for which they were responsible.

verses.name: Numbers 7:10
verses.text: When the altar was anointed, the leaders brought their offerings for its dedication and presented them before the altar.

verses.name: Numbers 7:11
verses.text: For the LORD had said to Moses, "Each day one leader is to bring his offering for the dedication of the altar."

verses.name: Numbers 7:12
verses.text: The one who brought his offering on the first day was Nahshon son of Amminadab of the tribe of Judah.

verses.name: Numbers 7:13
verses.text: His offering was one silver plate weighing a hundred and thirty shekels, and one silver sprinkling bowl weighing seventy shekels, both according to the sanctuary shekel, each filled with fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;

verses.name: Numbers 7:14
verses.text: one gold dish weighing ten shekels, filled with incense;

verses.name: Numbers 7:15
verses.text: one young bull, one ram and one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;

verses.name: Numbers 7:16
verses.text: one male goat for a sin offering;

verses.name: Numbers 7:17
verses.text: and two oxen, five rams, five male goats and five male lambs a year old, to be sacrificed as a fellowship offering. This was the offering of Nahshon son of Amminadab.

verses.name: Numbers 7:18
verses.text: On the second day Nethanel son of Zuar, the leader of Issachar, brought his offering.

verses.name: Numbers 7:19
verses.text: The offering he brought was one silver plate weighing a hundred and thirty shekels, and one silver sprinkling bowl weighing seventy shekels, both according to the sanctuary shekel, each filled with fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;

verses.name: Numbers 7:20
verses.text: one gold dish weighing ten shekels, filled with incense;

verses.name: Numbers 7:21
verses.text: one young bull, one ram and one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;

verses.name: Numbers 7:22
verses.text: one male goat for a sin offering;

verses.name: Numbers 7:23
verses.text: and two oxen, five rams, five male goats and five male lambs a year old, to be sacrificed as a fellowship offering. This was the offering of Nethanel son of Zuar.

verses.name: Numbers 7:24
verses.text: On the third day, Eliab son of Helon, the leader of the people of Zebulun, brought his offering.

verses.name: Numbers 7:25
verses.text: His offering was one silver plate weighing a hundred and thirty shekels, and one silver sprinkling bowl weighing seventy shekels, both according to the sanctuary shekel, each filled with fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;

verses.name: Numbers 7:26
verses.text: one gold dish weighing ten shekels, filled with incense;

verses.name: Numbers 7:27
verses.text: one young bull, one ram and one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;

verses.name: Numbers 7:28
verses.text: one male goat for a sin offering;

verses.name: Numbers 7:29
verses.text: and two oxen, five rams, five male goats and five male lambs a year old, to be sacrificed as a fellowship offering. This was the offering of Eliab son of Helon.

verses.name: Numbers 7:30
verses.text: On the fourth day Elizur son of Shedeur, the leader of the people of Reuben, brought his offering.

verses.name: Numbers 7:31
verses.text: His offering was one silver plate weighing a hundred and thirty shekels, and one silver sprinkling bowl weighing seventy shekels, both according to the sanctuary shekel, each filled with fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;

verses.name: Numbers 7:32
verses.text: one gold dish weighing ten shekels, filled with incense;

verses.name: Numbers 7:33
verses.text: one young bull, one ram and one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;

verses.name: Numbers 7:34
verses.text: one male goat for a sin offering;

verses.name: Numbers 7:35
verses.text: and two oxen, five rams, five male goats and five male lambs a year old, to be sacrificed as a fellowship offering. This was the offering of Elizur son of Shedeur.

verses.name: Numbers 7:36
verses.text: On the fifth day Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai, the leader of the people of Simeon, brought his offering.

verses.name: Numbers 7:37
verses.text: His offering was one silver plate weighing a hundred and thirty shekels, and one silver sprinkling bowl weighing seventy shekels, both according to the sanctuary shekel, each filled with fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;

verses.name: Numbers 7:38
verses.text: one gold dish weighing ten shekels, filled with incense;

verses.name: Numbers 7:39
verses.text: one young bull, one ram and one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;

verses.name: Numbers 7:40
verses.text: one male goat for a sin offering;

verses.name: Numbers 7:41
verses.text: and two oxen, five rams, five male goats and five male lambs a year old, to be sacrificed as a fellowship offering. This was the offering of Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai.

verses.name: Numbers 7:42
verses.text: On the sixth day Eliasaph son of Deuel, the leader of the people of Gad, brought his offering.

verses.name: Numbers 7:43
verses.text: His offering was one silver plate weighing a hundred and thirty shekels, and one silver sprinkling bowl weighing seventy shekels, both according to the sanctuary shekel, each filled with fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;

verses.name: Numbers 7:44
verses.text: one gold dish weighing ten shekels, filled with incense;

verses.name: Numbers 7:45
verses.text: one young bull, one ram and one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;

verses.name: Numbers 7:46
verses.text: one male goat for a sin offering;

verses.name: Numbers 7:47
verses.text: and two oxen, five rams, five male goats and five male lambs a year old, to be sacrificed as a fellowship offering. This was the offering of Eliasaph son of Deuel.

verses.name: Numbers 7:48
verses.text: On the seventh day Elishama son of Ammihud, the leader of the people of Ephraim, brought his offering.

verses.name: Numbers 7:49
verses.text: His offering was one silver plate weighing a hundred and thirty shekels, and one silver sprinkling bowl weighing seventy shekels, both according to the sanctuary shekel, each filled with fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;

verses.name: Numbers 7:50
verses.text: one gold dish weighing ten shekels, filled with incense;

verses.name: Numbers 7:51
verses.text: one young bull, one ram and one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;

verses.name: Numbers 7:52
verses.text: one male goat for a sin offering;

verses.name: Numbers 7:53
verses.text: and two oxen, five rams, five male goats and five male lambs a year old, to be sacrificed as a fellowship offering. This was the offering of Elishama son of Ammihud.

verses.name: Numbers 7:54
verses.text: On the eighth day Gamaliel son of Pedahzur, the leader of the people of Manasseh, brought his offering.

verses.name: Numbers 7:55
verses.text: His offering was one silver plate weighing a hundred and thirty shekels, and one silver sprinkling bowl weighing seventy shekels, both according to the sanctuary shekel, each filled with fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;

verses.name: Numbers 7:56
verses.text: one gold dish weighing ten shekels, filled with incense;

verses.name: Numbers 7:57
verses.text: one young bull, one ram and one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;

verses.name: Numbers 7:58
verses.text: one male goat for a sin offering;

verses.name: Numbers 7:59
verses.text: and two oxen, five rams, five male goats and five male lambs a year old, to be sacrificed as a fellowship offering. This was the offering of Gamaliel son of Pedahzur.

verses.name: Numbers 7:60
verses.text: On the ninth day Abidan son of Gideoni, the leader of the people of Benjamin, brought his offering.

verses.name: Numbers 7:61
verses.text: His offering was one silver plate weighing a hundred and thirty shekels, and one silver sprinkling bowl weighing seventy shekels, both according to the sanctuary shekel, each filled with fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;

verses.name: Numbers 7:62
verses.text: one gold dish weighing ten shekels, filled with incense;

verses.name: Numbers 7:63
verses.text: one young bull, one ram and one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;

verses.name: Numbers 7:64
verses.text: one male goat for a sin offering;

verses.name: Numbers 7:65
verses.text: and two oxen, five rams, five male goats and five male lambs a year old, to be sacrificed as a fellowship offering. This was the offering of Abidan son of Gideoni.

verses.name: Numbers 7:66
verses.text: On the tenth day Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai, the leader of the people of Dan, brought his offering.

verses.name: Numbers 7:67
verses.text: His offering was one silver plate weighing a hundred and thirty shekels, and one silver sprinkling bowl weighing seventy shekels, both according to the sanctuary shekel, each filled with fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;

verses.name: Numbers 7:68
verses.text: one gold dish weighing ten shekels, filled with incense;

verses.name: Numbers 7:69
verses.text: one young bull, one ram and one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;

verses.name: Numbers 7:70
verses.text: one male goat for a sin offering;

verses.name: Numbers 7:71
verses.text: and two oxen, five rams, five male goats and five male lambs a year old, to be sacrificed as a fellowship offering. This was the offering of Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai.

verses.name: Numbers 7:72
verses.text: On the eleventh day Pagiel son of Ocran, the leader of the people of Asher, brought his offering.

verses.name: Numbers 7:73
verses.text: His offering was one silver plate weighing a hundred and thirty shekels, and one silver sprinkling bowl weighing seventy shekels, both according to the sanctuary shekel, each filled with fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;

verses.name: Numbers 7:74
verses.text: one gold dish weighing ten shekels, filled with incense;

verses.name: Numbers 7:75
verses.text: one young bull, one ram and one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;

verses.name: Numbers 7:76
verses.text: one male goat for a sin offering;

verses.name: Numbers 7:77
verses.text: and two oxen, five rams, five male goats and five male lambs a year old, to be sacrificed as a fellowship offering. This was the offering of Pagiel son of Ocran.

verses.name: Numbers 7:78
verses.text: On the twelfth day Ahira son of Enan, the leader of the people of Naphtali, brought his offering.

verses.name: Numbers 7:79
verses.text: His offering was one silver plate weighing a hundred and thirty shekels, and one silver sprinkling bowl weighing seventy shekels, both according to the sanctuary shekel, each filled with fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering;

verses.name: Numbers 7:80
verses.text: one gold dish weighing ten shekels, filled with incense;

verses.name: Numbers 7:81
verses.text: one young bull, one ram and one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;

verses.name: Numbers 7:82
verses.text: one male goat for a sin offering;

verses.name: Numbers 7:83
verses.text: and two oxen, five rams, five male goats and five male lambs a year old, to be sacrificed as a fellowship offering. This was the offering of Ahira son of Enan.

verses.name: Numbers 7:84
verses.text: These were the offerings of the Israelite leaders for the dedication of the altar when it was anointed: twelve silver plates, twelve silver sprinkling bowls and twelve gold dishes.

verses.name: Numbers 7:85
verses.text: Each silver plate weighed a hundred and thirty shekels, and each sprinkling bowl seventy shekels. Altogether, the silver dishes weighed two thousand four hundred shekels, according to the sanctuary shekel.

verses.name: Numbers 7:86
verses.text: The twelve gold dishes filled with incense weighed ten shekels each, according to the sanctuary shekel. Altogether, the gold dishes weighed a hundred and twenty shekels.

verses.name: Numbers 7:87
verses.text: The total number of animals for the burnt offering came to twelve young bulls, twelve rams and twelve male lambs a year old, together with their grain offering. Twelve male goats were used for the sin offering.

verses.name: Numbers 7:88
verses.text: The total number of animals for the sacrifice of the fellowship offering came to twenty-four oxen, sixty rams, sixty male goats and sixty male lambs a year old. These were the offerings for the dedication of the altar after it was anointed.

verses.name: Numbers 7:89
verses.text: When Moses entered the Tent of Meeting to speak with the LORD, he heard the voice speaking to him from between the two cherubim above the atonement cover on the ark of the Testimony. And he spoke with him.

verses.name: Numbers 8:1
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses,

verses.name: Numbers 8:2
verses.text: "Speak to Aaron and say to him, 'When you set up the seven lamps, they are to light the area in front of the lampstand.'"

verses.name: Numbers 8:3
verses.text: Aaron did so; he set up the lamps so that they faced forward on the lampstand, just as the LORD commanded Moses.

verses.name: Numbers 8:4
verses.text: This is how the lampstand was made: It was made of hammered gold-from its base to its blossoms. The lampstand was made exactly like the pattern the LORD had shown Moses.

verses.name: Numbers 8:5
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses:

verses.name: Numbers 8:6
verses.text: "Take the Levites from among the other Israelites and make them ceremonially clean.

verses.name: Numbers 8:7
verses.text: To purify them, do this: Sprinkle the water of cleansing on them; then have them shave their whole bodies and wash their clothes, and so purify themselves.

verses.name: Numbers 8:8
verses.text: Have them take a young bull with its grain offering of fine flour mixed with oil; then you are to take a second young bull for a sin offering.

verses.name: Numbers 8:9
verses.text: Bring the Levites to the front of the Tent of Meeting and assemble the whole Israelite community.

verses.name: Numbers 8:10
verses.text: You are to bring the Levites before the LORD, and the Israelites are to lay their hands on them.

verses.name: Numbers 8:11
verses.text: Aaron is to present the Levites before the LORD as a wave offering from the Israelites, so that they may be ready to do the work of the LORD.

verses.name: Numbers 8:12
verses.text: "After the Levites lay their hands on the heads of the bulls, use the one for a sin offering to the LORD and the other for a burnt offering, to make atonement for the Levites.

verses.name: Numbers 8:13
verses.text: Have the Levites stand in front of Aaron and his sons and then present them as a wave offering to the LORD.

verses.name: Numbers 8:14
verses.text: In this way you are to set the Levites apart from the other Israelites, and the Levites will be mine.

verses.name: Numbers 8:15
verses.text: "After you have purified the Levites and presented them as a wave offering, they are to come to do their work at the Tent of Meeting.

verses.name: Numbers 8:16
verses.text: They are the Israelites who are to be given wholly to me. I have taken them as my own in place of the firstborn, the first male offspring from every Israelite woman.

verses.name: Numbers 8:17
verses.text: Every firstborn male in Israel, whether man or animal, is mine. When I struck down all the firstborn in Egypt, I set them apart for myself.

verses.name: Numbers 8:18
verses.text: And I have taken the Levites in place of all the firstborn sons in Israel.

verses.name: Numbers 8:19
verses.text: Of all the Israelites, I have given the Levites as gifts to Aaron and his sons to do the work at the Tent of Meeting on behalf of the Israelites and to make atonement for them so that no plague will strike the Israelites when they go near the sanctuary."

verses.name: Numbers 8:20
verses.text: Moses, Aaron and the whole Israelite community did with the Levites just as the LORD commanded Moses.

verses.name: Numbers 8:21
verses.text: The Levites purified themselves and washed their clothes. Then Aaron presented them as a wave offering before the LORD and made atonement for them to purify them.

verses.name: Numbers 8:22
verses.text: After that, the Levites came to do their work at the Tent of Meeting under the supervision of Aaron and his sons. They did with the Levites just as the LORD commanded Moses.

verses.name: Numbers 8:23
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses,

verses.name: Numbers 8:24
verses.text: "This applies to the Levites: Men twenty-five years old or more shall come to take part in the work at the Tent of Meeting,

verses.name: Numbers 8:25
verses.text: but at the age of fifty, they must retire from their regular service and work no longer.

verses.name: Numbers 8:26
verses.text: They may assist their brothers in performing their duties at the Tent of Meeting, but they themselves must not do the work. This, then, is how you are to assign the responsibilities of the Levites."

verses.name: Numbers 9:1
verses.text: The LORD spoke to Moses in the Desert of Sinai in the first month of the second year after they came out of Egypt. He said,

verses.name: Numbers 9:2
verses.text: "Have the Israelites celebrate the Passover at the appointed time.

verses.name: Numbers 9:3
verses.text: Celebrate it at the appointed time, at twilight on the fourteenth day of this month, in accordance with all its rules and regulations."

verses.name: Numbers 9:4
verses.text: So Moses told the Israelites to celebrate the Passover,

verses.name: Numbers 9:5
verses.text: and they did so in the Desert of Sinai at twilight on the fourteenth day of the first month. The Israelites did everything just as the LORD commanded Moses.

verses.name: Numbers 9:6
verses.text: But some of them could not celebrate the Passover on that day because they were ceremonially unclean on account of a dead body. So they came to Moses and Aaron that same day

verses.name: Numbers 9:7
verses.text: and said to Moses, "We have become unclean because of a dead body, but why should we be kept from presenting the LORD's offering with the other Israelites at the appointed time?"

verses.name: Numbers 9:8
verses.text: Moses answered them, "Wait until I find out what the LORD commands concerning you."

verses.name: Numbers 9:9
verses.text: Then the LORD said to Moses,

verses.name: Numbers 9:10
verses.text: "Tell the Israelites: 'When any of you or your descendants are unclean because of a dead body or are away on a journey, they may still celebrate the LORD's Passover.

verses.name: Numbers 9:11
verses.text: They are to celebrate it on the fourteenth day of the second month at twilight. They are to eat the lamb, together with unleavened bread and bitter herbs.

verses.name: Numbers 9:12
verses.text: They must not leave any of it till morning or break any of its bones. When they celebrate the Passover, they must follow all the regulations.

verses.name: Numbers 9:13
verses.text: But if a man who is ceremonially clean and not on a journey fails to celebrate the Passover, that person must be cut off from his people because he did not present the LORD's offering at the appointed time. That man will bear the consequences of his sin.

verses.name: Numbers 9:14
verses.text: "'An alien living among you who wants to celebrate the LORD's Passover must do so in accordance with its rules and regulations. You must have the same regulations for the alien and the native-born.'"

verses.name: Numbers 9:15
verses.text: On the day the tabernacle, the Tent of the Testimony, was set up, the cloud covered it. From evening till morning the cloud above the tabernacle looked like fire.

verses.name: Numbers 9:16
verses.text: That is how it continued to be; the cloud covered it, and at night it looked like fire.

verses.name: Numbers 9:17
verses.text: Whenever the cloud lifted from above the Tent, the Israelites set out; wherever the cloud settled, the Israelites encamped.

verses.name: Numbers 9:18
verses.text: At the LORD's command the Israelites set out, and at his command they encamped. As long as the cloud stayed over the tabernacle, they remained in camp.

verses.name: Numbers 9:19
verses.text: When the cloud remained over the tabernacle a long time, the Israelites obeyed the LORD's order and did not set out.

verses.name: Numbers 9:20
verses.text: Sometimes the cloud was over the tabernacle only a few days; at the LORD's command they would encamp, and then at his command they would set out.

verses.name: Numbers 9:21
verses.text: Sometimes the cloud stayed only from evening till morning, and when it lifted in the morning, they set out. Whether by day or by night, whenever the cloud lifted, they set out.

verses.name: Numbers 9:22
verses.text: Whether the cloud stayed over the tabernacle for two days or a month or a year, the Israelites would remain in camp and not set out; but when it lifted, they would set out.

verses.name: Numbers 9:23
verses.text: At the LORD's command they encamped, and at the LORD's command they set out. They obeyed the LORD's order, in accordance with his command through Moses.

verses.name: Numbers 10:1
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses:

verses.name: Numbers 10:2
verses.text: "Make two trumpets of hammered silver, and use them for calling the community together and for having the camps set out.

verses.name: Numbers 10:3
verses.text: When both are sounded, the whole community is to assemble before you at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.

verses.name: Numbers 10:4
verses.text: If only one is sounded, the leaders-the heads of the clans of Israel-are to assemble before you.

verses.name: Numbers 10:5
verses.text: When a trumpet blast is sounded, the tribes camping on the east are to set out.

verses.name: Numbers 10:6
verses.text: At the sounding of a second blast, the camps on the south are to set out. The blast will be the signal for setting out.

verses.name: Numbers 10:7
verses.text: To gather the assembly, blow the trumpets, but not with the same signal.

verses.name: Numbers 10:8
verses.text: "The sons of Aaron, the priests, are to blow the trumpets. This is to be a lasting ordinance for you and the generations to come.

verses.name: Numbers 10:9
verses.text: When you go into battle in your own land against an enemy who is oppressing you, sound a blast on the trumpets. Then you will be remembered by the LORD your God and rescued from your enemies.

verses.name: Numbers 10:10
verses.text: Also at your times of rejoicing-your appointed feasts and New Moon festivals-you are to sound the trumpets over your burnt offerings and fellowship offerings, and they will be a memorial for you before your God. I am the LORD your God."

verses.name: Numbers 10:11
verses.text: On the twentieth day of the second month of the second year, the cloud lifted from above the tabernacle of the Testimony.

verses.name: Numbers 10:12
verses.text: Then the Israelites set out from the Desert of Sinai and traveled from place to place until the cloud came to rest in the Desert of Paran.

verses.name: Numbers 10:13
verses.text: They set out, this first time, at the LORD's command through Moses.

verses.name: Numbers 10:14
verses.text: The divisions of the camp of Judah went first, under their standard. Nahshon son of Amminadab was in command.

verses.name: Numbers 10:15
verses.text: Nethanel son of Zuar was over the division of the tribe of Issachar,

verses.name: Numbers 10:16
verses.text: and Eliab son of Helon was over the division of the tribe of Zebulun.

verses.name: Numbers 10:17
verses.text: Then the tabernacle was taken down, and the Gershonites and Merarites, who carried it, set out.

verses.name: Numbers 10:18
verses.text: The divisions of the camp of Reuben went next, under their standard. Elizur son of Shedeur was in command.

verses.name: Numbers 10:19
verses.text: Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai was over the division of the tribe of Simeon,

verses.name: Numbers 10:20
verses.text: and Eliasaph son of Deuel was over the division of the tribe of Gad.

verses.name: Numbers 10:21
verses.text: Then the Kohathites set out, carrying the holy things. The tabernacle was to be set up before they arrived.

verses.name: Numbers 10:22
verses.text: The divisions of the camp of Ephraim went next, under their standard. Elishama son of Ammihud was in command.

verses.name: Numbers 10:23
verses.text: Gamaliel son of Pedahzur was over the division of the tribe of Manasseh,

verses.name: Numbers 10:24
verses.text: and Abidan son of Gideoni was over the division of the tribe of Benjamin.

verses.name: Numbers 10:25
verses.text: Finally, as the rear guard for all the units, the divisions of the camp of Dan set out, under their standard. Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai was in command.

verses.name: Numbers 10:26
verses.text: Pagiel son of Ocran was over the division of the tribe of Asher,

verses.name: Numbers 10:27
verses.text: and Ahira son of Enan was over the division of the tribe of Naphtali.

verses.name: Numbers 10:28
verses.text: This was the order of march for the Israelite divisions as they set out.

verses.name: Numbers 10:29
verses.text: Now Moses said to Hobab son of Reuel the Midianite, Moses' father-in-law, "We are setting out for the place about which the LORD said, 'I will give it to you.' Come with us and we will treat you well, for the LORD has promised good things to Israel."

verses.name: Numbers 10:30
verses.text: He answered, "No, I will not go; I am going back to my own land and my own people."

verses.name: Numbers 10:31
verses.text: But Moses said, "Please do not leave us. You know where we should camp in the desert, and you can be our eyes.

verses.name: Numbers 10:32
verses.text: If you come with us, we will share with you whatever good things the LORD gives us."

verses.name: Numbers 10:33
verses.text: So they set out from the mountain of the LORD and traveled for three days. The ark of the covenant of the LORD went before them during those three days to find them a place to rest.

verses.name: Numbers 10:34
verses.text: The cloud of the LORD was over them by day when they set out from the camp.

verses.name: Numbers 10:35
verses.text: Whenever the ark set out, Moses said, "Rise up, O LORD! May your enemies be scattered; may your foes flee before you."

verses.name: Numbers 10:36
verses.text: Whenever it came to rest, he said, "Return, O LORD, to the countless thousands of Israel."

verses.name: Numbers 11:1
verses.text: Now the people complained about their hardships in the hearing of the LORD, and when he heard them his anger was aroused. Then fire from the LORD burned among them and consumed some of the outskirts of the camp.

verses.name: Numbers 11:2
verses.text: When the people cried out to Moses, he prayed to the LORD and the fire died down.

verses.name: Numbers 11:3
verses.text: So that place was called Taberah, because fire from the LORD had burned among them. Quail From the LORD

verses.name: Numbers 11:4
verses.text: The rabble with them began to crave other food, and again the Israelites started wailing and said, "If only we had meat to eat!

verses.name: Numbers 11:5
verses.text: We remember the fish we ate in Egypt at no cost-also the cucumbers, melons, leeks, onions and garlic.

verses.name: Numbers 11:6
verses.text: But now we have lost our appetite; we never see anything but this manna!"

verses.name: Numbers 11:7
verses.text: The manna was like coriander seed and looked like resin.

verses.name: Numbers 11:8
verses.text: The people went around gathering it, and then ground it in a handmill or crushed it in a mortar. They cooked it in a pot or made it into cakes. And it tasted like something made with olive oil.

verses.name: Numbers 11:9
verses.text: When the dew settled on the camp at night, the manna also came down.

verses.name: Numbers 11:10
verses.text: Moses heard the people of every family wailing, each at the entrance to his tent. The LORD became exceedingly angry, and Moses was troubled.

verses.name: Numbers 11:11
verses.text: He asked the LORD, "Why have you brought this trouble on your servant? What have I done to displease you that you put the burden of all these people on me?

verses.name: Numbers 11:12
verses.text: Did I conceive all these people? Did I give them birth? Why do you tell me to carry them in my arms, as a nurse carries an infant, to the land you promised on oath to their forefathers?

verses.name: Numbers 11:13
verses.text: Where can I get meat for all these people? They keep wailing to me, 'Give us meat to eat!'

verses.name: Numbers 11:14
verses.text: I cannot carry all these people by myself; the burden is too heavy for me.

verses.name: Numbers 11:15
verses.text: If this is how you are going to treat me, put me to death right now-if I have found favor in your eyes-and do not let me face my own ruin."

verses.name: Numbers 11:16
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses: "Bring me seventy of Israel's elders who are known to you as leaders and officials among the people. Have them come to the Tent of Meeting, that they may stand there with you.

verses.name: Numbers 11:17
verses.text: I will come down and speak with you there, and I will take of the Spirit that is on you and put the Spirit on them. They will help you carry the burden of the people so that you will not have to carry it alone.

verses.name: Numbers 11:18
verses.text: "Tell the people: 'Consecrate yourselves in preparation for tomorrow, when you will eat meat. The LORD heard you when you wailed, "If only we had meat to eat! We were better off in Egypt!" Now the LORD will give you meat, and you will eat it.

verses.name: Numbers 11:19
verses.text: You will not eat it for just one day, or two days, or five, ten or twenty days,

verses.name: Numbers 11:20
verses.text: but for a whole month-until it comes out of your nostrils and you loathe it-because you have rejected the LORD, who is among you, and have wailed before him, saying, "Why did we ever leave Egypt?"'"

verses.name: Numbers 11:21
verses.text: But Moses said, "Here I am among six hundred thousand men on foot, and you say, 'I will give them meat to eat for a whole month!'

verses.name: Numbers 11:22
verses.text: Would they have enough if flocks and herds were slaughtered for them? Would they have enough if all the fish in the sea were caught for them?"

verses.name: Numbers 11:23
verses.text: The LORD answered Moses, "Is the LORD's arm too short? You will now see whether or not what I say will come true for you."

verses.name: Numbers 11:24
verses.text: So Moses went out and told the people what the LORD had said. He brought together seventy of their elders and had them stand around the Tent.

verses.name: Numbers 11:25
verses.text: Then the LORD came down in the cloud and spoke with him, and he took of the Spirit that was on him and put the Spirit on the seventy elders. When the Spirit rested on them, they prophesied, but they did not do so again.

verses.name: Numbers 11:26
verses.text: However, two men, whose names were Eldad and Medad, had remained in the camp. They were listed among the elders, but did not go out to the Tent. Yet the Spirit also rested on them, and they prophesied in the camp.

verses.name: Numbers 11:27
verses.text: A young man ran and told Moses, "Eldad and Medad are prophesying in the camp."

verses.name: Numbers 11:28
verses.text: Joshua son of Nun, who had been Moses' aide since youth, spoke up and said, "Moses, my lord, stop them!"

verses.name: Numbers 11:29
verses.text: But Moses replied, "Are you jealous for my sake? I wish that all the LORD's people were prophets and that the LORD would put his Spirit on them!"

verses.name: Numbers 11:30
verses.text: Then Moses and the elders of Israel returned to the camp.

verses.name: Numbers 11:31
verses.text: Now a wind went out from the LORD and drove quail in from the sea. It brought them down all around the camp to about three feet above the ground, as far as a day's walk in any direction.

verses.name: Numbers 11:32
verses.text: All that day and night and all the next day the people went out and gathered quail. No one gathered less than ten homers. Then they spread them out all around the camp.

verses.name: Numbers 11:33
verses.text: But while the meat was still between their teeth and before it could be consumed, the anger of the LORD burned against the people, and he struck them with a severe plague.

verses.name: Numbers 11:34
verses.text: Therefore the place was named Kibroth Hattaavah, because there they buried the people who had craved other food.

verses.name: Numbers 11:35
verses.text: From Kibroth Hattaavah the people traveled to Hazeroth and stayed there.

verses.name: Numbers 12:1
verses.text: Miriam and Aaron began to talk against Moses because of his Cushite wife, for he had married a Cushite.

verses.name: Numbers 12:2
verses.text: "Has the LORD spoken only through Moses?" they asked. "Hasn't he also spoken through us?" And the LORD heard this.

verses.name: Numbers 12:3
verses.text: (Now Moses was a very humble man, more humble than anyone else on the face of the earth.)

verses.name: Numbers 12:4
verses.text: At once the LORD said to Moses, Aaron and Miriam, "Come out to the Tent of Meeting, all three of you." So the three of them came out.

verses.name: Numbers 12:5
verses.text: Then the LORD came down in a pillar of cloud; he stood at the entrance to the Tent and summoned Aaron and Miriam. When both of them stepped forward,

verses.name: Numbers 12:6
verses.text: he said, "Listen to my words: "When a prophet of the LORD is among you, I reveal myself to him in visions, I speak to him in dreams.

verses.name: Numbers 12:7
verses.text: But this is not true of my servant Moses; he is faithful in all my house.

verses.name: Numbers 12:8
verses.text: With him I speak face to face, clearly and not in riddles; he sees the form of the LORD. Why then were you not afraid to speak against my servant Moses?"

verses.name: Numbers 12:9
verses.text: The anger of the LORD burned against them, and he left them.

verses.name: Numbers 12:10
verses.text: When the cloud lifted from above the Tent, there stood Miriam-leprous, like snow. Aaron turned toward her and saw that she had leprosy;

verses.name: Numbers 12:11
verses.text: and he said to Moses, "Please, my lord, do not hold against us the sin we have so foolishly committed.

verses.name: Numbers 12:12
verses.text: Do not let her be like a stillborn infant coming from its mother's womb with its flesh half eaten away."

verses.name: Numbers 12:13
verses.text: So Moses cried out to the LORD, "O God, please heal her!"

verses.name: Numbers 12:14
verses.text: The LORD replied to Moses, "If her father had spit in her face, would she not have been in disgrace for seven days? Confine her outside the camp for seven days; after that she can be brought back."

verses.name: Numbers 12:15
verses.text: So Miriam was confined outside the camp for seven days, and the people did not move on till she was brought back.

verses.name: Numbers 12:16
verses.text: After that, the people left Hazeroth and encamped in the Desert of Paran.

verses.name: Numbers 13:1
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses,

verses.name: Numbers 13:2
verses.text: "Send some men to explore the land of Canaan, which I am giving to the Israelites. From each ancestral tribe send one of its leaders."

verses.name: Numbers 13:3
verses.text: So at the LORD's command Moses sent them out from the Desert of Paran. All of them were leaders of the Israelites.

verses.name: Numbers 13:4
verses.text: These are their names: from the tribe of Reuben, Shammua son of Zaccur;

verses.name: Numbers 13:5
verses.text: from the tribe of Simeon, Shaphat son of Hori;

verses.name: Numbers 13:6
verses.text: from the tribe of Judah, Caleb son of Jephunneh;

verses.name: Numbers 13:7
verses.text: from the tribe of Issachar, Igal son of Joseph;

verses.name: Numbers 13:8
verses.text: from the tribe of Ephraim, Hoshea son of Nun;

verses.name: Numbers 13:9
verses.text: from the tribe of Benjamin, Palti son of Raphu;

verses.name: Numbers 13:10
verses.text: from the tribe of Zebulun, Gaddiel son of Sodi;

verses.name: Numbers 13:11
verses.text: from the tribe of Manasseh (a tribe of Joseph), Gaddi son of Susi;

verses.name: Numbers 13:12
verses.text: from the tribe of Dan, Ammiel son of Gemalli;

verses.name: Numbers 13:13
verses.text: from the tribe of Asher, Sethur son of Michael;

verses.name: Numbers 13:14
verses.text: from the tribe of Naphtali, Nahbi son of Vophsi;

verses.name: Numbers 13:15
verses.text: from the tribe of Gad, Geuel son of Maki.

verses.name: Numbers 13:16
verses.text: These are the names of the men Moses sent to explore the land. (Moses gave Hoshea son of Nun the name Joshua.)

verses.name: Numbers 13:17
verses.text: When Moses sent them to explore Canaan, he said, "Go up through the Negev and on into the hill country.

verses.name: Numbers 13:18
verses.text: See what the land is like and whether the people who live there are strong or weak, few or many.

verses.name: Numbers 13:19
verses.text: What kind of land do they live in? Is it good or bad? What kind of towns do they live in? Are they unwalled or fortified?

verses.name: Numbers 13:20
verses.text: How is the soil? Is it fertile or poor? Are there trees on it or not? Do your best to bring back some of the fruit of the land." (It was the season for the first ripe grapes.)

verses.name: Numbers 13:21
verses.text: So they went up and explored the land from the Desert of Zin as far as Rehob, toward Lebo Hamath.

verses.name: Numbers 13:22
verses.text: They went up through the Negev and came to Hebron, where Ahiman, Sheshai and Talmai, the descendants of Anak, lived. (Hebron had been built seven years before Zoan in Egypt.)

verses.name: Numbers 13:23
verses.text: When they reached the Valley of Eshcol, they cut off a branch bearing a single cluster of grapes. Two of them carried it on a pole between them, along with some pomegranates and figs.

verses.name: Numbers 13:24
verses.text: That place was called the Valley of Eshcol because of the cluster of grapes the Israelites cut off there.

verses.name: Numbers 13:25
verses.text: At the end of forty days they returned from exploring the land.

verses.name: Numbers 13:26
verses.text: They came back to Moses and Aaron and the whole Israelite community at Kadesh in the Desert of Paran. There they reported to them and to the whole assembly and showed them the fruit of the land.

verses.name: Numbers 13:27
verses.text: They gave Moses this account: "We went into the land to which you sent us, and it does flow with milk and honey! Here is its fruit.

verses.name: Numbers 13:28
verses.text: But the people who live there are powerful, and the cities are fortified and very large. We even saw descendants of Anak there.

verses.name: Numbers 13:29
verses.text: The Amalekites live in the Negev; the Hittites, Jebusites and Amorites live in the hill country; and the Canaanites live near the sea and along the Jordan."

verses.name: Numbers 13:30
verses.text: Then Caleb silenced the people before Moses and said, "We should go up and take possession of the land, for we can certainly do it."

verses.name: Numbers 13:31
verses.text: But the men who had gone up with him said, "We can't attack those people; they are stronger than we are."

verses.name: Numbers 13:32
verses.text: And they spread among the Israelites a bad report about the land they had explored. They said, "The land we explored devours those living in it. All the people we saw there are of great size.

verses.name: Numbers 13:33
verses.text: We saw the Nephilim there (the descendants of Anak come from the Nephilim). We seemed like grasshoppers in our own eyes, and we looked the same to them."

verses.name: Numbers 14:1
verses.text: That night all the people of the community raised their voices and wept aloud.

verses.name: Numbers 14:2
verses.text: All the Israelites grumbled against Moses and Aaron, and the whole assembly said to them, "If only we had died in Egypt! Or in this desert!

verses.name: Numbers 14:3
verses.text: Why is the LORD bringing us to this land only to let us fall by the sword? Our wives and children will be taken as plunder. Wouldn't it be better for us to go back to Egypt?"

verses.name: Numbers 14:4
verses.text: And they said to each other, "We should choose a leader and go back to Egypt."

verses.name: Numbers 14:5
verses.text: Then Moses and Aaron fell facedown in front of the whole Israelite assembly gathered there.

verses.name: Numbers 14:6
verses.text: Joshua son of Nun and Caleb son of Jephunneh, who were among those who had explored the land, tore their clothes

verses.name: Numbers 14:7
verses.text: and said to the entire Israelite assembly, "The land we passed through and explored is exceedingly good.

verses.name: Numbers 14:8
verses.text: If the LORD is pleased with us, he will lead us into that land, a land flowing with milk and honey, and will give it to us.
