verses.name: Numbers 14:9
verses.text: Only do not rebel against the LORD. And do not be afraid of the people of the land, because we will swallow them up. Their protection is gone, but the LORD is with us. Do not be afraid of them."

verses.name: Numbers 14:10
verses.text: But the whole assembly talked about stoning them. Then the glory of the LORD appeared at the Tent of Meeting to all the Israelites.

verses.name: Numbers 14:11
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses, "How long will these people treat me with contempt? How long will they refuse to believe in me, in spite of all the miraculous signs I have performed among them?

verses.name: Numbers 14:12
verses.text: I will strike them down with a plague and destroy them, but I will make you into a nation greater and stronger than they."

verses.name: Numbers 14:13
verses.text: Moses said to the LORD, "Then the Egyptians will hear about it! By your power you brought these people up from among them.

verses.name: Numbers 14:14
verses.text: And they will tell the inhabitants of this land about it. They have already heard that you, O LORD, are with these people and that you, O LORD, have been seen face to face, that your cloud stays over them, and that you go before them in a pillar of cloud by day and a pillar of fire by night.

verses.name: Numbers 14:15
verses.text: If you put these people to death all at one time, the nations who have heard this report about you will say,

verses.name: Numbers 14:16
verses.text: 'The LORD was not able to bring these people into the land he promised them on oath; so he slaughtered them in the desert.'

verses.name: Numbers 14:17
verses.text: "Now may the Lord's strength be displayed, just as you have declared:

verses.name: Numbers 14:18
verses.text: 'The LORD is slow to anger, abounding in love and forgiving sin and rebellion. Yet he does not leave the guilty unpunished; he punishes the children for the sin of the fathers to the third and fourth generation.'

verses.name: Numbers 14:19
verses.text: In accordance with your great love, forgive the sin of these people, just as you have pardoned them from the time they left Egypt until now."

verses.name: Numbers 14:20
verses.text: The LORD replied, "I have forgiven them, as you asked.

verses.name: Numbers 14:21
verses.text: Nevertheless, as surely as I live and as surely as the glory of the LORD fills the whole earth,

verses.name: Numbers 14:22
verses.text: not one of the men who saw my glory and the miraculous signs I performed in Egypt and in the desert but who disobeyed me and tested me ten times-

verses.name: Numbers 14:23
verses.text: not one of them will ever see the land I promised on oath to their forefathers. No one who has treated me with contempt will ever see it.

verses.name: Numbers 14:24
verses.text: But because my servant Caleb has a different spirit and follows me wholeheartedly, I will bring him into the land he went to, and his descendants will inherit it.

verses.name: Numbers 14:25
verses.text: Since the Amalekites and Canaanites are living in the valleys, turn back tomorrow and set out toward the desert along the route to the Red Sea. "

verses.name: Numbers 14:26
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses and Aaron:

verses.name: Numbers 14:27
verses.text: "How long will this wicked community grumble against me? I have heard the complaints of these grumbling Israelites.

verses.name: Numbers 14:28
verses.text: So tell them, 'As surely as I live, declares the LORD, I will do to you the very things I heard you say:

verses.name: Numbers 14:29
verses.text: In this desert your bodies will fall-every one of you twenty years old or more who was counted in the census and who has grumbled against me.

verses.name: Numbers 14:30
verses.text: Not one of you will enter the land I swore with uplifted hand to make your home, except Caleb son of Jephunneh and Joshua son of Nun.

verses.name: Numbers 14:31
verses.text: As for your children that you said would be taken as plunder, I will bring them in to enjoy the land you have rejected.

verses.name: Numbers 14:32
verses.text: But you-your bodies will fall in this desert.

verses.name: Numbers 14:33
verses.text: Your children will be shepherds here for forty years, suffering for your unfaithfulness, until the last of your bodies lies in the desert.

verses.name: Numbers 14:34
verses.text: For forty years-one year for each of the forty days you explored the land-you will suffer for your sins and know what it is like to have me against you.'

verses.name: Numbers 14:35
verses.text: I, the LORD, have spoken, and I will surely do these things to this whole wicked community, which has banded together against me. They will meet their end in this desert; here they will die."

verses.name: Numbers 14:36
verses.text: So the men Moses had sent to explore the land, who returned and made the whole community grumble against him by spreading a bad report about it-

verses.name: Numbers 14:37
verses.text: these men responsible for spreading the bad report about the land were struck down and died of a plague before the LORD.

verses.name: Numbers 14:38
verses.text: Of the men who went to explore the land, only Joshua son of Nun and Caleb son of Jephunneh survived.

verses.name: Numbers 14:39
verses.text: When Moses reported this to all the Israelites, they mourned bitterly.

verses.name: Numbers 14:40
verses.text: Early the next morning they went up toward the high hill country. "We have sinned," they said. "We will go up to the place the LORD promised."

verses.name: Numbers 14:41
verses.text: But Moses said, "Why are you disobeying the LORD's command? This will not succeed!

verses.name: Numbers 14:42
verses.text: Do not go up, because the LORD is not with you. You will be defeated by your enemies,

verses.name: Numbers 14:43
verses.text: for the Amalekites and Canaanites will face you there. Because you have turned away from the LORD, he will not be with you and you will fall by the sword."

verses.name: Numbers 14:44
verses.text: Nevertheless, in their presumption they went up toward the high hill country, though neither Moses nor the ark of the LORD's covenant moved from the camp.

verses.name: Numbers 14:45
verses.text: Then the Amalekites and Canaanites who lived in that hill country came down and attacked them and beat them down all the way to Hormah.

verses.name: Numbers 15:1
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses,

verses.name: Numbers 15:2
verses.text: "Speak to the Israelites and say to them: 'After you enter the land I am giving you as a home

verses.name: Numbers 15:3
verses.text: and you present to the LORD offerings made by fire, from the herd or the flock, as an aroma pleasing to the LORD -whether burnt offerings or sacrifices, for special vows or freewill offerings or festival offerings-

verses.name: Numbers 15:4
verses.text: then the one who brings his offering shall present to the LORD a grain offering of a tenth of an ephah of fine flour mixed with a quarter of a hin of oil.

verses.name: Numbers 15:5
verses.text: With each lamb for the burnt offering or the sacrifice, prepare a quarter of a hin of wine as a drink offering.

verses.name: Numbers 15:6
verses.text: "'With a ram prepare a grain offering of two-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with a third of a hin of oil,

verses.name: Numbers 15:7
verses.text: and a third of a hin of wine as a drink offering. Offer it as an aroma pleasing to the LORD.

verses.name: Numbers 15:8
verses.text: "'When you prepare a young bull as a burnt offering or sacrifice, for a special vow or a fellowship offering to the LORD,

verses.name: Numbers 15:9
verses.text: bring with the bull a grain offering of three-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with half a hin of oil.

verses.name: Numbers 15:10
verses.text: Also bring half a hin of wine as a drink offering. It will be an offering made by fire, an aroma pleasing to the LORD.

verses.name: Numbers 15:11
verses.text: Each bull or ram, each lamb or young goat, is to be prepared in this manner.

verses.name: Numbers 15:12
verses.text: Do this for each one, for as many as you prepare.

verses.name: Numbers 15:13
verses.text: "'Everyone who is native-born must do these things in this way when he brings an offering made by fire as an aroma pleasing to the LORD.

verses.name: Numbers 15:14
verses.text: For the generations to come, whenever an alien or anyone else living among you presents an offering made by fire as an aroma pleasing to the LORD, he must do exactly as you do.

verses.name: Numbers 15:15
verses.text: The community is to have the same rules for you and for the alien living among you; this is a lasting ordinance for the generations to come. You and the alien shall be the same before the LORD:

verses.name: Numbers 15:16
verses.text: The same laws and regulations will apply both to you and to the alien living among you.'"

verses.name: Numbers 15:17
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses,

verses.name: Numbers 15:18
verses.text: "Speak to the Israelites and say to them: 'When you enter the land to which I am taking you

verses.name: Numbers 15:19
verses.text: and you eat the food of the land, present a portion as an offering to the LORD.

verses.name: Numbers 15:20
verses.text: Present a cake from the first of your ground meal and present it as an offering from the threshing floor.

verses.name: Numbers 15:21
verses.text: Throughout the generations to come you are to give this offering to the LORD from the first of your ground meal.

verses.name: Numbers 15:22
verses.text: "'Now if you unintentionally fail to keep any of these commands the LORD gave Moses-

verses.name: Numbers 15:23
verses.text: any of the LORD's commands to you through him, from the day the LORD gave them and continuing through the generations to come-

verses.name: Numbers 15:24
verses.text: and if this is done unintentionally without the community being aware of it, then the whole community is to offer a young bull for a burnt offering as an aroma pleasing to the LORD, along with its prescribed grain offering and drink offering, and a male goat for a sin offering.

verses.name: Numbers 15:25
verses.text: The priest is to make atonement for the whole Israelite community, and they will be forgiven, for it was not intentional and they have brought to the LORD for their wrong an offering made by fire and a sin offering.

verses.name: Numbers 15:26
verses.text: The whole Israelite community and the aliens living among them will be forgiven, because all the people were involved in the unintentional wrong.

verses.name: Numbers 15:27
verses.text: "'But if just one person sins unintentionally, he must bring a year-old female goat for a sin offering.

verses.name: Numbers 15:28
verses.text: The priest is to make atonement before the LORD for the one who erred by sinning unintentionally, and when atonement has been made for him, he will be forgiven.

verses.name: Numbers 15:29
verses.text: One and the same law applies to everyone who sins unintentionally, whether he is a native-born Israelite or an alien.

verses.name: Numbers 15:30
verses.text: "'But anyone who sins defiantly, whether native-born or alien, blasphemes the LORD, and that person must be cut off from his people.

verses.name: Numbers 15:31
verses.text: Because he has despised the LORD's word and broken his commands, that person must surely be cut off; his guilt remains on him.'"

verses.name: Numbers 15:32
verses.text: While the Israelites were in the desert, a man was found gathering wood on the Sabbath day.

verses.name: Numbers 15:33
verses.text: Those who found him gathering wood brought him to Moses and Aaron and the whole assembly,

verses.name: Numbers 15:34
verses.text: and they kept him in custody, because it was not clear what should be done to him.

verses.name: Numbers 15:35
verses.text: Then the LORD said to Moses, "The man must die. The whole assembly must stone him outside the camp."

verses.name: Numbers 15:36
verses.text: So the assembly took him outside the camp and stoned him to death, as the LORD commanded Moses.

verses.name: Numbers 15:37
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses,

verses.name: Numbers 15:38
verses.text: "Speak to the Israelites and say to them: 'Throughout the generations to come you are to make tassels on the corners of your garments, with a blue cord on each tassel.

verses.name: Numbers 15:39
verses.text: You will have these tassels to look at and so you will remember all the commands of the LORD, that you may obey them and not prostitute yourselves by going after the lusts of your own hearts and eyes.

verses.name: Numbers 15:40
verses.text: Then you will remember to obey all my commands and will be consecrated to your God.

verses.name: Numbers 15:41
verses.text: I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of Egypt to be your God. I am the LORD your God.'"

verses.name: Numbers 16:1
verses.text: Korah son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, and certain Reubenites-Dathan and Abiram, sons of Eliab, and On son of Peleth-became insolent

verses.name: Numbers 16:2
verses.text: and rose up against Moses. With them were 250 Israelite men, well-known community leaders who had been appointed members of the council.

verses.name: Numbers 16:3
verses.text: They came as a group to oppose Moses and Aaron and said to them, "You have gone too far! The whole community is holy, every one of them, and the LORD is with them. Why then do you set yourselves above the LORD's assembly?"

verses.name: Numbers 16:4
verses.text: When Moses heard this, he fell facedown.

verses.name: Numbers 16:5
verses.text: Then he said to Korah and all his followers: "In the morning the LORD will show who belongs to him and who is holy, and he will have that person come near him. The man he chooses he will cause to come near him.

verses.name: Numbers 16:6
verses.text: You, Korah, and all your followers are to do this: Take censers

verses.name: Numbers 16:7
verses.text: and tomorrow put fire and incense in them before the LORD. The man the LORD chooses will be the one who is holy. You Levites have gone too far!"

verses.name: Numbers 16:8
verses.text: Moses also said to Korah, "Now listen, you Levites!

verses.name: Numbers 16:9
verses.text: Isn't it enough for you that the God of Israel has separated you from the rest of the Israelite community and brought you near himself to do the work at the LORD's tabernacle and to stand before the community and minister to them?

verses.name: Numbers 16:10
verses.text: He has brought you and all your fellow Levites near himself, but now you are trying to get the priesthood too.

verses.name: Numbers 16:11
verses.text: It is against the LORD that you and all your followers have banded together. Who is Aaron that you should grumble against him?"

verses.name: Numbers 16:12
verses.text: Then Moses summoned Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab. But they said, "We will not come!

verses.name: Numbers 16:13
verses.text: Isn't it enough that you have brought us up out of a land flowing with milk and honey to kill us in the desert? And now you also want to lord it over us?

verses.name: Numbers 16:14
verses.text: Moreover, you haven't brought us into a land flowing with milk and honey or given us an inheritance of fields and vineyards. Will you gouge out the eyes of these men? No, we will not come!"

verses.name: Numbers 16:15
verses.text: Then Moses became very angry and said to the LORD, "Do not accept their offering. I have not taken so much as a donkey from them, nor have I wronged any of them."

verses.name: Numbers 16:16
verses.text: Moses said to Korah, "You and all your followers are to appear before the LORD tomorrow-you and they and Aaron.

verses.name: Numbers 16:17
verses.text: Each man is to take his censer and put incense in it-250 censers in all-and present it before the LORD. You and Aaron are to present your censers also."

verses.name: Numbers 16:18
verses.text: So each man took his censer, put fire and incense in it, and stood with Moses and Aaron at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.

verses.name: Numbers 16:19
verses.text: When Korah had gathered all his followers in opposition to them at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting, the glory of the LORD appeared to the entire assembly.

verses.name: Numbers 16:20
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses and Aaron,

verses.name: Numbers 16:21
verses.text: "Separate yourselves from this assembly so I can put an end to them at once."

verses.name: Numbers 16:22
verses.text: But Moses and Aaron fell facedown and cried out, "O God, God of the spirits of all mankind, will you be angry with the entire assembly when only one man sins?"

verses.name: Numbers 16:23
verses.text: Then the LORD said to Moses,

verses.name: Numbers 16:24
verses.text: "Say to the assembly, 'Move away from the tents of Korah, Dathan and Abiram.'"

verses.name: Numbers 16:25
verses.text: Moses got up and went to Dathan and Abiram, and the elders of Israel followed him.

verses.name: Numbers 16:26
verses.text: He warned the assembly, "Move back from the tents of these wicked men! Do not touch anything belonging to them, or you will be swept away because of all their sins."

verses.name: Numbers 16:27
verses.text: So they moved away from the tents of Korah, Dathan and Abiram. Dathan and Abiram had come out and were standing with their wives, children and little ones at the entrances to their tents.

verses.name: Numbers 16:28
verses.text: Then Moses said, "This is how you will know that the LORD has sent me to do all these things and that it was not my idea:

verses.name: Numbers 16:29
verses.text: If these men die a natural death and experience only what usually happens to men, then the LORD has not sent me.

verses.name: Numbers 16:30
verses.text: But if the LORD brings about something totally new, and the earth opens its mouth and swallows them, with everything that belongs to them, and they go down alive into the grave, then you will know that these men have treated the LORD with contempt."

verses.name: Numbers 16:31
verses.text: As soon as he finished saying all this, the ground under them split apart

verses.name: Numbers 16:32
verses.text: and the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them, with their households and all Korah's men and all their possessions.

verses.name: Numbers 16:33
verses.text: They went down alive into the grave, with everything they owned; the earth closed over them, and they perished and were gone from the community.

verses.name: Numbers 16:34
verses.text: At their cries, all the Israelites around them fled, shouting, "The earth is going to swallow us too!"

verses.name: Numbers 16:35
verses.text: And fire came out from the LORD and consumed the 250 men who were offering the incense.

verses.name: Numbers 16:36
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses,

verses.name: Numbers 16:37
verses.text: "Tell Eleazar son of Aaron, the priest, to take the censers out of the smoldering remains and scatter the coals some distance away, for the censers are holy-

verses.name: Numbers 16:38
verses.text: the censers of the men who sinned at the cost of their lives. Hammer the censers into sheets to overlay the altar, for they were presented before the LORD and have become holy. Let them be a sign to the Israelites."

verses.name: Numbers 16:39
verses.text: So Eleazar the priest collected the bronze censers brought by those who had been burned up, and he had them hammered out to overlay the altar,

verses.name: Numbers 16:40
verses.text: as the LORD directed him through Moses. This was to remind the Israelites that no one except a descendant of Aaron should come to burn incense before the LORD, or he would become like Korah and his followers.

verses.name: Numbers 16:41
verses.text: The next day the whole Israelite community grumbled against Moses and Aaron. "You have killed the LORD's people," they said.

verses.name: Numbers 16:42
verses.text: But when the assembly gathered in opposition to Moses and Aaron and turned toward the Tent of Meeting, suddenly the cloud covered it and the glory of the LORD appeared.

verses.name: Numbers 16:43
verses.text: Then Moses and Aaron went to the front of the Tent of Meeting,

verses.name: Numbers 16:44
verses.text: and the LORD said to Moses,

verses.name: Numbers 16:45
verses.text: "Get away from this assembly so I can put an end to them at once." And they fell facedown.

verses.name: Numbers 16:46
verses.text: Then Moses said to Aaron, "Take your censer and put incense in it, along with fire from the altar, and hurry to the assembly to make atonement for them. Wrath has come out from the LORD; the plague has started."

verses.name: Numbers 16:47
verses.text: So Aaron did as Moses said, and ran into the midst of the assembly. The plague had already started among the people, but Aaron offered the incense and made atonement for them.

verses.name: Numbers 16:48
verses.text: He stood between the living and the dead, and the plague stopped.

verses.name: Numbers 16:49
verses.text: But 14,700 people died from the plague, in addition to those who had died because of Korah.

verses.name: Numbers 16:50
verses.text: Then Aaron returned to Moses at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting, for the plague had stopped.

verses.name: Numbers 17:1
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses,

verses.name: Numbers 17:2
verses.text: "Speak to the Israelites and get twelve staffs from them, one from the leader of each of their ancestral tribes. Write the name of each man on his staff.

verses.name: Numbers 17:3
verses.text: On the staff of Levi write Aaron's name, for there must be one staff for the head of each ancestral tribe.

verses.name: Numbers 17:4
verses.text: Place them in the Tent of Meeting in front of the Testimony, where I meet with you.

verses.name: Numbers 17:5
verses.text: The staff belonging to the man I choose will sprout, and I will rid myself of this constant grumbling against you by the Israelites."

verses.name: Numbers 17:6
verses.text: So Moses spoke to the Israelites, and their leaders gave him twelve staffs, one for the leader of each of their ancestral tribes, and Aaron's staff was among them.

verses.name: Numbers 17:7
verses.text: Moses placed the staffs before the LORD in the Tent of the Testimony.

verses.name: Numbers 17:8
verses.text: The next day Moses entered the Tent of the Testimony and saw that Aaron's staff, which represented the house of Levi, had not only sprouted but had budded, blossomed and produced almonds.

verses.name: Numbers 17:9
verses.text: Then Moses brought out all the staffs from the LORD's presence to all the Israelites. They looked at them, and each man took his own staff.

verses.name: Numbers 17:10
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses, "Put back Aaron's staff in front of the Testimony, to be kept as a sign to the rebellious. This will put an end to their grumbling against me, so that they will not die."

verses.name: Numbers 17:11
verses.text: Moses did just as the LORD commanded him.

verses.name: Numbers 17:12
verses.text: The Israelites said to Moses, "We will die! We are lost, we are all lost!

verses.name: Numbers 17:13
verses.text: Anyone who even comes near the tabernacle of the LORD will die. Are we all going to die?"

verses.name: Numbers 18:1
verses.text: The LORD said to Aaron, "You, your sons and your father's family are to bear the responsibility for offenses against the sanctuary, and you and your sons alone are to bear the responsibility for offenses against the priesthood.

verses.name: Numbers 18:2
verses.text: Bring your fellow Levites from your ancestral tribe to join you and assist you when you and your sons minister before the Tent of the Testimony.

verses.name: Numbers 18:3
verses.text: They are to be responsible to you and are to perform all the duties of the Tent, but they must not go near the furnishings of the sanctuary or the altar, or both they and you will die.

verses.name: Numbers 18:4
verses.text: They are to join you and be responsible for the care of the Tent of Meeting-all the work at the Tent-and no one else may come near where you are.

verses.name: Numbers 18:5
verses.text: "You are to be responsible for the care of the sanctuary and the altar, so that wrath will not fall on the Israelites again.

verses.name: Numbers 18:6
verses.text: I myself have selected your fellow Levites from among the Israelites as a gift to you, dedicated to the LORD to do the work at the Tent of Meeting.

verses.name: Numbers 18:7
verses.text: But only you and your sons may serve as priests in connection with everything at the altar and inside the curtain. I am giving you the service of the priesthood as a gift. Anyone else who comes near the sanctuary must be put to death."

verses.name: Numbers 18:8
verses.text: Then the LORD said to Aaron, "I myself have put you in charge of the offerings presented to me; all the holy offerings the Israelites give me I give to you and your sons as your portion and regular share.

verses.name: Numbers 18:9
verses.text: You are to have the part of the most holy offerings that is kept from the fire. From all the gifts they bring me as most holy offerings, whether grain or sin or guilt offerings, that part belongs to you and your sons.

verses.name: Numbers 18:10
verses.text: Eat it as something most holy; every male shall eat it. You must regard it as holy.

verses.name: Numbers 18:11
verses.text: "This also is yours: whatever is set aside from the gifts of all the wave offerings of the Israelites. I give this to you and your sons and daughters as your regular share. Everyone in your household who is ceremonially clean may eat it.

verses.name: Numbers 18:12
verses.text: "I give you all the finest olive oil and all the finest new wine and grain they give the LORD as the firstfruits of their harvest.

verses.name: Numbers 18:13
verses.text: All the land's firstfruits that they bring to the LORD will be yours. Everyone in your household who is ceremonially clean may eat it.

verses.name: Numbers 18:14
verses.text: "Everything in Israel that is devoted to the LORD is yours.

verses.name: Numbers 18:15
verses.text: The first offspring of every womb, both man and animal, that is offered to the LORD is yours. But you must redeem every firstborn son and every firstborn male of unclean animals.

verses.name: Numbers 18:16
verses.text: When they are a month old, you must redeem them at the redemption price set at five shekels of silver, according to the sanctuary shekel, which weighs twenty gerahs.

verses.name: Numbers 18:17
verses.text: "But you must not redeem the firstborn of an ox, a sheep or a goat; they are holy. Sprinkle their blood on the altar and burn their fat as an offering made by fire, an aroma pleasing to the LORD.

verses.name: Numbers 18:18
verses.text: Their meat is to be yours, just as the breast of the wave offering and the right thigh are yours.

verses.name: Numbers 18:19
verses.text: Whatever is set aside from the holy offerings the Israelites present to the LORD I give to you and your sons and daughters as your regular share. It is an everlasting covenant of salt before the LORD for both you and your offspring."

verses.name: Numbers 18:20
verses.text: The LORD said to Aaron, "You will have no inheritance in their land, nor will you have any share among them; I am your share and your inheritance among the Israelites.

verses.name: Numbers 18:21
verses.text: "I give to the Levites all the tithes in Israel as their inheritance in return for the work they do while serving at the Tent of Meeting.

verses.name: Numbers 18:22
verses.text: From now on the Israelites must not go near the Tent of Meeting, or they will bear the consequences of their sin and will die.

verses.name: Numbers 18:23
verses.text: It is the Levites who are to do the work at the Tent of Meeting and bear the responsibility for offenses against it. This is a lasting ordinance for the generations to come. They will receive no inheritance among the Israelites.

verses.name: Numbers 18:24
verses.text: Instead, I give to the Levites as their inheritance the tithes that the Israelites present as an offering to the LORD. That is why I said concerning them: 'They will have no inheritance among the Israelites.'"

verses.name: Numbers 18:25
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses,

verses.name: Numbers 18:26
verses.text: "Speak to the Levites and say to them: 'When you receive from the Israelites the tithe I give you as your inheritance, you must present a tenth of that tithe as the LORD's offering.

verses.name: Numbers 18:27
verses.text: Your offering will be reckoned to you as grain from the threshing floor or juice from the winepress.

verses.name: Numbers 18:28
verses.text: In this way you also will present an offering to the LORD from all the tithes you receive from the Israelites. From these tithes you must give the LORD's portion to Aaron the priest.

verses.name: Numbers 18:29
verses.text: You must present as the LORD's portion the best and holiest part of everything given to you.'

verses.name: Numbers 18:30
verses.text: "Say to the Levites: 'When you present the best part, it will be reckoned to you as the product of the threshing floor or the winepress.

verses.name: Numbers 18:31
verses.text: You and your households may eat the rest of it anywhere, for it is your wages for your work at the Tent of Meeting.

verses.name: Numbers 18:32
verses.text: By presenting the best part of it you will not be guilty in this matter; then you will not defile the holy offerings of the Israelites, and you will not die.'"

verses.name: Numbers 19:1
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses and Aaron:

verses.name: Numbers 19:2
verses.text: "This is a requirement of the law that the LORD has commanded: Tell the Israelites to bring you a red heifer without defect or blemish and that has never been under a yoke.

verses.name: Numbers 19:3
verses.text: Give it to Eleazar the priest; it is to be taken outside the camp and slaughtered in his presence.

verses.name: Numbers 19:4
verses.text: Then Eleazar the priest is to take some of its blood on his finger and sprinkle it seven times toward the front of the Tent of Meeting.

verses.name: Numbers 19:5
verses.text: While he watches, the heifer is to be burned-its hide, flesh, blood and offal.

verses.name: Numbers 19:6
verses.text: The priest is to take some cedar wood, hyssop and scarlet wool and throw them onto the burning heifer.

verses.name: Numbers 19:7
verses.text: After that, the priest must wash his clothes and bathe himself with water. He may then come into the camp, but he will be ceremonially unclean till evening.

verses.name: Numbers 19:8
verses.text: The man who burns it must also wash his clothes and bathe with water, and he too will be unclean till evening.

verses.name: Numbers 19:9
verses.text: "A man who is clean shall gather up the ashes of the heifer and put them in a ceremonially clean place outside the camp. They shall be kept by the Israelite community for use in the water of cleansing; it is for purification from sin.

verses.name: Numbers 19:10
verses.text: The man who gathers up the ashes of the heifer must also wash his clothes, and he too will be unclean till evening. This will be a lasting ordinance both for the Israelites and for the aliens living among them.

verses.name: Numbers 19:11
verses.text: "Whoever touches the dead body of anyone will be unclean for seven days.

verses.name: Numbers 19:12
verses.text: He must purify himself with the water on the third day and on the seventh day; then he will be clean. But if he does not purify himself on the third and seventh days, he will not be clean.

verses.name: Numbers 19:13
verses.text: Whoever touches the dead body of anyone and fails to purify himself defiles the LORD's tabernacle. That person must be cut off from Israel. Because the water of cleansing has not been sprinkled on him, he is unclean; his uncleanness remains on him.

verses.name: Numbers 19:14
verses.text: "This is the law that applies when a person dies in a tent: Anyone who enters the tent and anyone who is in it will be unclean for seven days,

verses.name: Numbers 19:15
verses.text: and every open container without a lid fastened on it will be unclean.

verses.name: Numbers 19:16
verses.text: "Anyone out in the open who touches someone who has been killed with a sword or someone who has died a natural death, or anyone who touches a human bone or a grave, will be unclean for seven days.

verses.name: Numbers 19:17
verses.text: "For the unclean person, put some ashes from the burned purification offering into a jar and pour fresh water over them.

verses.name: Numbers 19:18
verses.text: Then a man who is ceremonially clean is to take some hyssop, dip it in the water and sprinkle the tent and all the furnishings and the people who were there. He must also sprinkle anyone who has touched a human bone or a grave or someone who has been killed or someone who has died a natural death.

verses.name: Numbers 19:19
verses.text: The man who is clean is to sprinkle the unclean person on the third and seventh days, and on the seventh day he is to purify him. The person being cleansed must wash his clothes and bathe with water, and that evening he will be clean.

verses.name: Numbers 19:20
verses.text: But if a person who is unclean does not purify himself, he must be cut off from the community, because he has defiled the sanctuary of the LORD. The water of cleansing has not been sprinkled on him, and he is unclean.

verses.name: Numbers 19:21
verses.text: This is a lasting ordinance for them. "The man who sprinkles the water of cleansing must also wash his clothes, and anyone who touches the water of cleansing will be unclean till evening.

verses.name: Numbers 19:22
verses.text: Anything that an unclean person touches becomes unclean, and anyone who touches it becomes unclean till evening."

verses.name: Numbers 20:1
verses.text: In the first month the whole Israelite community arrived at the Desert of Zin, and they stayed at Kadesh. There Miriam died and was buried.

verses.name: Numbers 20:2
verses.text: Now there was no water for the community, and the people gathered in opposition to Moses and Aaron.

verses.name: Numbers 20:3
verses.text: They quarreled with Moses and said, "If only we had died when our brothers fell dead before the LORD!

verses.name: Numbers 20:4
verses.text: Why did you bring the LORD's community into this desert, that we and our livestock should die here?

verses.name: Numbers 20:5
verses.text: Why did you bring us up out of Egypt to this terrible place? It has no grain or figs, grapevines or pomegranates. And there is no water to drink!"

verses.name: Numbers 20:6
verses.text: Moses and Aaron went from the assembly to the entrance to the Tent of Meeting and fell facedown, and the glory of the LORD appeared to them.

verses.name: Numbers 20:7
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses,

verses.name: Numbers 20:8
verses.text: "Take the staff, and you and your brother Aaron gather the assembly together. Speak to that rock before their eyes and it will pour out its water. You will bring water out of the rock for the community so they and their livestock can drink."

verses.name: Numbers 20:9
verses.text: So Moses took the staff from the LORD's presence, just as he commanded him.

verses.name: Numbers 20:10
verses.text: He and Aaron gathered the assembly together in front of the rock and Moses said to them, "Listen, you rebels, must we bring you water out of this rock?"

verses.name: Numbers 20:11
verses.text: Then Moses raised his arm and struck the rock twice with his staff. Water gushed out, and the community and their livestock drank.

verses.name: Numbers 20:12
verses.text: But the LORD said to Moses and Aaron, "Because you did not trust in me enough to honor me as holy in the sight of the Israelites, you will not bring this community into the land I give them."

verses.name: Numbers 20:13
verses.text: These were the waters of Meribah, where the Israelites quarreled with the LORD and where he showed himself holy among them.

verses.name: Numbers 20:14
verses.text: Moses sent messengers from Kadesh to the king of Edom, saying: "This is what your brother Israel says: You know about all the hardships that have come upon us.

verses.name: Numbers 20:15
verses.text: Our forefathers went down into Egypt, and we lived there many years. The Egyptians mistreated us and our fathers,

verses.name: Numbers 20:16
verses.text: but when we cried out to the LORD, he heard our cry and sent an angel and brought us out of Egypt. "Now we are here at Kadesh, a town on the edge of your territory.

verses.name: Numbers 20:17
verses.text: Please let us pass through your country. We will not go through any field or vineyard, or drink water from any well. We will travel along the king's highway and not turn to the right or to the left until we have passed through your territory."

verses.name: Numbers 20:18
verses.text: But Edom answered: "You may not pass through here; if you try, we will march out and attack you with the sword."

verses.name: Numbers 20:19
verses.text: The Israelites replied: "We will go along the main road, and if we or our livestock drink any of your water, we will pay for it. We only want to pass through on foot-nothing else."

verses.name: Numbers 20:20
verses.text: Again they answered: "You may not pass through." Then Edom came out against them with a large and powerful army.

verses.name: Numbers 20:21
verses.text: Since Edom refused to let them go through their territory, Israel turned away from them.

verses.name: Numbers 20:22
verses.text: The whole Israelite community set out from Kadesh and came to Mount Hor.

verses.name: Numbers 20:23
verses.text: At Mount Hor, near the border of Edom, the LORD said to Moses and Aaron,

verses.name: Numbers 20:24
verses.text: "Aaron will be gathered to his people. He will not enter the land I give the Israelites, because both of you rebelled against my command at the waters of Meribah.

verses.name: Numbers 20:25
verses.text: Get Aaron and his son Eleazar and take them up Mount Hor.

verses.name: Numbers 20:26
verses.text: Remove Aaron's garments and put them on his son Eleazar, for Aaron will be gathered to his people; he will die there."

verses.name: Numbers 20:27
verses.text: Moses did as the LORD commanded: They went up Mount Hor in the sight of the whole community.

verses.name: Numbers 20:28
verses.text: Moses removed Aaron's garments and put them on his son Eleazar. And Aaron died there on top of the mountain. Then Moses and Eleazar came down from the mountain,

verses.name: Numbers 20:29
verses.text: and when the whole community learned that Aaron had died, the entire house of Israel mourned for him thirty days.

verses.name: Numbers 21:1
verses.text: When the Canaanite king of Arad, who lived in the Negev, heard that Israel was coming along the road to Atharim, he attacked the Israelites and captured some of them.

verses.name: Numbers 21:2
verses.text: Then Israel made this vow to the LORD: "If you will deliver these people into our hands, we will totally destroy their cities."

verses.name: Numbers 21:3
verses.text: The LORD listened to Israel's plea and gave the Canaanites over to them. They completely destroyed them and their towns; so the place was named Hormah.

verses.name: Numbers 21:4
verses.text: They traveled from Mount Hor along the route to the Red Sea, to go around Edom. But the people grew impatient on the way;

verses.name: Numbers 21:5
verses.text: they spoke against God and against Moses, and said, "Why have you brought us up out of Egypt to die in the desert? There is no bread! There is no water! And we detest this miserable food!"

verses.name: Numbers 21:6
verses.text: Then the LORD sent venomous snakes among them; they bit the people and many Israelites died.

verses.name: Numbers 21:7
verses.text: The people came to Moses and said, "We sinned when we spoke against the LORD and against you. Pray that the LORD will take the snakes away from us." So Moses prayed for the people.

verses.name: Numbers 21:8
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses, "Make a snake and put it up on a pole; anyone who is bitten can look at it and live."

verses.name: Numbers 21:9
verses.text: So Moses made a bronze snake and put it up on a pole. Then when anyone was bitten by a snake and looked at the bronze snake, he lived.

verses.name: Numbers 21:10
verses.text: The Israelites moved on and camped at Oboth.

verses.name: Numbers 21:11
verses.text: Then they set out from Oboth and camped in Iye Abarim, in the desert that faces Moab toward the sunrise.

verses.name: Numbers 21:12
verses.text: From there they moved on and camped in the Zered Valley.

verses.name: Numbers 21:13
verses.text: They set out from there and camped alongside the Arnon, which is in the desert extending into Amorite territory. The Arnon is the border of Moab, between Moab and the Amorites.

verses.name: Numbers 21:14
verses.text: That is why the Book of the Wars of the LORD says: "...Waheb in Suphah and the ravines, the Arnon

verses.name: Numbers 21:15
verses.text: and the slopes of the ravines that lead to the site of Ar and lie along the border of Moab."

verses.name: Numbers 21:16
verses.text: From there they continued on to Beer, the well where the LORD said to Moses, "Gather the people together and I will give them water."

verses.name: Numbers 21:17
verses.text: Then Israel sang this song: "Spring up, O well! Sing about it,

verses.name: Numbers 21:18
verses.text: about the well that the princes dug, that the nobles of the people sank- the nobles with scepters and staffs." Then they went from the desert to Mattanah,

verses.name: Numbers 21:19
verses.text: from Mattanah to Nahaliel, from Nahaliel to Bamoth,

verses.name: Numbers 21:20
verses.text: and from Bamoth to the valley in Moab where the top of Pisgah overlooks the wasteland.

verses.name: Numbers 21:21
verses.text: Israel sent messengers to say to Sihon king of the Amorites:

verses.name: Numbers 21:22
verses.text: "Let us pass through your country. We will not turn aside into any field or vineyard, or drink water from any well. We will travel along the king's highway until we have passed through your territory."

verses.name: Numbers 21:23
verses.text: But Sihon would not let Israel pass through his territory. He mustered his entire army and marched out into the desert against Israel. When he reached Jahaz, he fought with Israel.

verses.name: Numbers 21:24
verses.text: Israel, however, put him to the sword and took over his land from the Arnon to the Jabbok, but only as far as the Ammonites, because their border was fortified.

verses.name: Numbers 21:25
verses.text: Israel captured all the cities of the Amorites and occupied them, including Heshbon and all its surrounding settlements.

verses.name: Numbers 21:26
verses.text: Heshbon was the city of Sihon king of the Amorites, who had fought against the former king of Moab and had taken from him all his land as far as the Arnon.

verses.name: Numbers 21:27
verses.text: That is why the poets say: "Come to Heshbon and let it be rebuilt; let Sihon's city be restored.

verses.name: Numbers 21:28
verses.text: "Fire went out from Heshbon, a blaze from the city of Sihon. It consumed Ar of Moab, the citizens of Arnon's heights.

verses.name: Numbers 21:29
verses.text: Woe to you, O Moab! You are destroyed, O people of Chemosh! He has given up his sons as fugitives and his daughters as captives to Sihon king of the Amorites.

verses.name: Numbers 21:30
verses.text: "But we have overthrown them; Heshbon is destroyed all the way to Dibon. We have demolished them as far as Nophah, which extends to Medeba."

verses.name: Numbers 21:31
verses.text: So Israel settled in the land of the Amorites.

verses.name: Numbers 21:32
verses.text: After Moses had sent spies to Jazer, the Israelites captured its surrounding settlements and drove out the Amorites who were there.

verses.name: Numbers 21:33
verses.text: Then they turned and went up along the road toward Bashan, and Og king of Bashan and his whole army marched out to meet them in battle at Edrei.

verses.name: Numbers 21:34
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses, "Do not be afraid of him, for I have handed him over to you, with his whole army and his land. Do to him what you did to Sihon king of the Amorites, who reigned in Heshbon."

verses.name: Numbers 21:35
verses.text: So they struck him down, together with his sons and his whole army, leaving them no survivors. And they took possession of his land.

verses.name: Numbers 22:1
verses.text: Then the Israelites traveled to the plains of Moab and camped along the Jordan across from Jericho.

verses.name: Numbers 22:2
verses.text: Now Balak son of Zippor saw all that Israel had done to the Amorites,

verses.name: Numbers 22:3
verses.text: and Moab was terrified because there were so many people. Indeed, Moab was filled with dread because of the Israelites.

verses.name: Numbers 22:4
verses.text: The Moabites said to the elders of Midian, "This horde is going to lick up everything around us, as an ox licks up the grass of the field." So Balak son of Zippor, who was king of Moab at that time,

verses.name: Numbers 22:5
verses.text: sent messengers to summon Balaam son of Beor, who was at Pethor, near the River, in his native land. Balak said: "A people has come out of Egypt; they cover the face of the land and have settled next to me.

verses.name: Numbers 22:6
verses.text: Now come and put a curse on these people, because they are too powerful for me. Perhaps then I will be able to defeat them and drive them out of the country. For I know that those you bless are blessed, and those you curse are cursed."

verses.name: Numbers 22:7
verses.text: The elders of Moab and Midian left, taking with them the fee for divination. When they came to Balaam, they told him what Balak had said.

verses.name: Numbers 22:8
verses.text: "Spend the night here," Balaam said to them, "and I will bring you back the answer the LORD gives me." So the Moabite princes stayed with him.

verses.name: Numbers 22:9
verses.text: God came to Balaam and asked, "Who are these men with you?"

verses.name: Numbers 22:10
verses.text: Balaam said to God, "Balak son of Zippor, king of Moab, sent me this message:

verses.name: Numbers 22:11
verses.text: 'A people that has come out of Egypt covers the face of the land. Now come and put a curse on them for me. Perhaps then I will be able to fight them and drive them away.'"

verses.name: Numbers 22:12
verses.text: But God said to Balaam, "Do not go with them. You must not put a curse on those people, because they are blessed."

verses.name: Numbers 22:13
verses.text: The next morning Balaam got up and said to Balak's princes, "Go back to your own country, for the LORD has refused to let me go with you."

verses.name: Numbers 22:14
verses.text: So the Moabite princes returned to Balak and said, "Balaam refused to come with us."

verses.name: Numbers 22:15
verses.text: Then Balak sent other princes, more numerous and more distinguished than the first.

verses.name: Numbers 22:16
verses.text: They came to Balaam and said: "This is what Balak son of Zippor says: Do not let anything keep you from coming to me,

verses.name: Numbers 22:17
verses.text: because I will reward you handsomely and do whatever you say. Come and put a curse on these people for me."

verses.name: Numbers 22:18
verses.text: But Balaam answered them, "Even if Balak gave me his palace filled with silver and gold, I could not do anything great or small to go beyond the command of the LORD my God.

verses.name: Numbers 22:19
verses.text: Now stay here tonight as the others did, and I will find out what else the LORD will tell me."

verses.name: Numbers 22:20
verses.text: That night God came to Balaam and said, "Since these men have come to summon you, go with them, but do only what I tell you."

verses.name: Numbers 22:21
verses.text: Balaam got up in the morning, saddled his donkey and went with the princes of Moab.

verses.name: Numbers 22:22
verses.text: But God was very angry when he went, and the angel of the LORD stood in the road to oppose him. Balaam was riding on his donkey, and his two servants were with him.

verses.name: Numbers 22:23
verses.text: When the donkey saw the angel of the LORD standing in the road with a drawn sword in his hand, she turned off the road into a field. Balaam beat her to get her back on the road.

verses.name: Numbers 22:24
verses.text: Then the angel of the LORD stood in a narrow path between two vineyards, with walls on both sides.

verses.name: Numbers 22:25
verses.text: When the donkey saw the angel of the LORD, she pressed close to the wall, crushing Balaam's foot against it. So he beat her again.

verses.name: Numbers 22:26
verses.text: Then the angel of the LORD moved on ahead and stood in a narrow place where there was no room to turn, either to the right or to the left.

verses.name: Numbers 22:27
verses.text: When the donkey saw the angel of the LORD, she lay down under Balaam, and he was angry and beat her with his staff.

verses.name: Numbers 22:28
verses.text: Then the LORD opened the donkey's mouth, and she said to Balaam, "What have I done to you to make you beat me these three times?"

verses.name: Numbers 22:29
verses.text: Balaam answered the donkey, "You have made a fool of me! If I had a sword in my hand, I would kill you right now."

verses.name: Numbers 22:30
verses.text: The donkey said to Balaam, "Am I not your own donkey, which you have always ridden, to this day? Have I been in the habit of doing this to you?No," he said.

verses.name: Numbers 22:31
verses.text: Then the LORD opened Balaam's eyes, and he saw the angel of the LORD standing in the road with his sword drawn. So he bowed low and fell facedown.

verses.name: Numbers 22:32
verses.text: The angel of the LORD asked him, "Why have you beaten your donkey these three times? I have come here to oppose you because your path is a reckless one before me.

verses.name: Numbers 22:33
verses.text: The donkey saw me and turned away from me these three times. If she had not turned away, I would certainly have killed you by now, but I would have spared her."

verses.name: Numbers 22:34
verses.text: Balaam said to the angel of the LORD, "I have sinned. I did not realize you were standing in the road to oppose me. Now if you are displeased, I will go back."

verses.name: Numbers 22:35
verses.text: The angel of the LORD said to Balaam, "Go with the men, but speak only what I tell you." So Balaam went with the princes of Balak.

verses.name: Numbers 22:36
verses.text: When Balak heard that Balaam was coming, he went out to meet him at the Moabite town on the Arnon border, at the edge of his territory.

verses.name: Numbers 22:37
verses.text: Balak said to Balaam, "Did I not send you an urgent summons? Why didn't you come to me? Am I really not able to reward you?"

verses.name: Numbers 22:38
verses.text: "Well, I have come to you now," Balaam replied. "But can I say just anything? I must speak only what God puts in my mouth."

verses.name: Numbers 22:39
verses.text: Then Balaam went with Balak to Kiriath Huzoth.

verses.name: Numbers 22:40
verses.text: Balak sacrificed cattle and sheep, and gave some to Balaam and the princes who were with him.

verses.name: Numbers 22:41
verses.text: The next morning Balak took Balaam up to Bamoth Baal, and from there he saw part of the people.

verses.name: Numbers 23:1
verses.text: Balaam said, "Build me seven altars here, and prepare seven bulls and seven rams for me."

verses.name: Numbers 23:2
verses.text: Balak did as Balaam said, and the two of them offered a bull and a ram on each altar.

verses.name: Numbers 23:3
verses.text: Then Balaam said to Balak, "Stay here beside your offering while I go aside. Perhaps the LORD will come to meet with me. Whatever he reveals to me I will tell you." Then he went off to a barren height.

verses.name: Numbers 23:4
verses.text: God met with him, and Balaam said, "I have prepared seven altars, and on each altar I have offered a bull and a ram."

verses.name: Numbers 23:5
verses.text: The LORD put a message in Balaam's mouth and said, "Go back to Balak and give him this message."

verses.name: Numbers 23:6
verses.text: So he went back to him and found him standing beside his offering, with all the princes of Moab.

verses.name: Numbers 23:7
verses.text: Then Balaam uttered his oracle: "Balak brought me from Aram, the king of Moab from the eastern mountains. 'Come,' he said, 'curse Jacob for me; come, denounce Israel.'

verses.name: Numbers 23:8
verses.text: How can I curse those whom God has not cursed? How can I denounce those whom the LORD has not denounced?

verses.name: Numbers 23:9
verses.text: From the rocky peaks I see them, from the heights I view them. I see a people who live apart and do not consider themselves one of the nations.

verses.name: Numbers 23:10
verses.text: Who can count the dust of Jacob or number the fourth part of Israel? Let me die the death of the righteous, and may my end be like theirs!"

verses.name: Numbers 23:11
verses.text: Balak said to Balaam, "What have you done to me? I brought you to curse my enemies, but you have done nothing but bless them!"

verses.name: Numbers 23:12
verses.text: He answered, "Must I not speak what the LORD puts in my mouth?"

verses.name: Numbers 23:13
verses.text: Then Balak said to him, "Come with me to another place where you can see them; you will see only a part but not all of them. And from there, curse them for me."

verses.name: Numbers 23:14
verses.text: So he took him to the field of Zophim on the top of Pisgah, and there he built seven altars and offered a bull and a ram on each altar.

verses.name: Numbers 23:15
verses.text: Balaam said to Balak, "Stay here beside your offering while I meet with him over there."

verses.name: Numbers 23:16
verses.text: The LORD met with Balaam and put a message in his mouth and said, "Go back to Balak and give him this message."

verses.name: Numbers 23:17
verses.text: So he went to him and found him standing beside his offering, with the princes of Moab. Balak asked him, "What did the LORD say?"

verses.name: Numbers 23:18
verses.text: Then he uttered his oracle: "Arise, Balak, and listen; hear me, son of Zippor.

verses.name: Numbers 23:19
verses.text: God is not a man, that he should lie, nor a son of man, that he should change his mind. Does he speak and then not act? Does he promise and not fulfill?

verses.name: Numbers 23:20
verses.text: I have received a command to bless; he has blessed, and I cannot change it.

verses.name: Numbers 23:21
verses.text: "No misfortune is seen in Jacob, no misery observed in Israel. The LORD their God is with them; the shout of the King is among them.

verses.name: Numbers 23:22
verses.text: God brought them out of Egypt; they have the strength of a wild ox.

verses.name: Numbers 23:23
verses.text: There is no sorcery against Jacob, no divination against Israel. It will now be said of Jacob and of Israel, 'See what God has done!'

verses.name: Numbers 23:24
verses.text: The people rise like a lioness; they rouse themselves like a lion that does not rest till he devours his prey and drinks the blood of his victims."

verses.name: Numbers 23:25
verses.text: Then Balak said to Balaam, "Neither curse them at all nor bless them at all!"

verses.name: Numbers 23:26
verses.text: Balaam answered, "Did I not tell you I must do whatever the LORD says?"

verses.name: Numbers 23:27
verses.text: Then Balak said to Balaam, "Come, let me take you to another place. Perhaps it will please God to let you curse them for me from there."

verses.name: Numbers 23:28
verses.text: And Balak took Balaam to the top of Peor, overlooking the wasteland.

verses.name: Numbers 23:29
verses.text: Balaam said, "Build me seven altars here, and prepare seven bulls and seven rams for me."

verses.name: Numbers 23:30
verses.text: Balak did as Balaam had said, and offered a bull and a ram on each altar.

verses.name: Numbers 24:1
verses.text: Now when Balaam saw that it pleased the LORD to bless Israel, he did not resort to sorcery as at other times, but turned his face toward the desert.

verses.name: Numbers 24:2
verses.text: When Balaam looked out and saw Israel encamped tribe by tribe, the Spirit of God came upon him

verses.name: Numbers 24:3
verses.text: and he uttered his oracle: "The oracle of Balaam son of Beor, the oracle of one whose eye sees clearly,

verses.name: Numbers 24:4
verses.text: the oracle of one who hears the words of God, who sees a vision from the Almighty, who falls prostrate, and whose eyes are opened:

verses.name: Numbers 24:5
verses.text: "How beautiful are your tents, O Jacob, your dwelling places, O Israel!

verses.name: Numbers 24:6
verses.text: "Like valleys they spread out, like gardens beside a river, like aloes planted by the LORD, like cedars beside the waters.

verses.name: Numbers 24:7
verses.text: Water will flow from their buckets; their seed will have abundant water. "Their king will be greater than Agag; their kingdom will be exalted.

verses.name: Numbers 24:8
verses.text: "God brought them out of Egypt; they have the strength of a wild ox. They devour hostile nations and break their bones in pieces; with their arrows they pierce them.

verses.name: Numbers 24:9
verses.text: Like a lion they crouch and lie down, like a lioness-who dares to rouse them? "May those who bless you be blessed and those who curse you be cursed!"

verses.name: Numbers 24:10
verses.text: Then Balak's anger burned against Balaam. He struck his hands together and said to him, "I summoned you to curse my enemies, but you have blessed them these three times.

verses.name: Numbers 24:11
verses.text: Now leave at once and go home! I said I would reward you handsomely, but the LORD has kept you from being rewarded."

verses.name: Numbers 24:12
verses.text: Balaam answered Balak, "Did I not tell the messengers you sent me,

verses.name: Numbers 24:13
verses.text: 'Even if Balak gave me his palace filled with silver and gold, I could not do anything of my own accord, good or bad, to go beyond the command of the LORD -and I must say only what the LORD says'?

verses.name: Numbers 24:14
verses.text: Now I am going back to my people, but come, let me warn you of what this people will do to your people in days to come."

verses.name: Numbers 24:15
verses.text: Then he uttered his oracle: "The oracle of Balaam son of Beor, the oracle of one whose eye sees clearly,

verses.name: Numbers 24:16
verses.text: the oracle of one who hears the words of God, who has knowledge from the Most High, who sees a vision from the Almighty, who falls prostrate, and whose eyes are opened:

verses.name: Numbers 24:17
verses.text: "I see him, but not now; I behold him, but not near. A star will come out of Jacob; a scepter will rise out of Israel. He will crush the foreheads of Moab, the skulls of all the sons of Sheth.

verses.name: Numbers 24:18
verses.text: Edom will be conquered; Seir, his enemy, will be conquered, but Israel will grow strong.

verses.name: Numbers 24:19
verses.text: A ruler will come out of Jacob and destroy the survivors of the city."

verses.name: Numbers 24:20
verses.text: Then Balaam saw Amalek and uttered his oracle: "Amalek was first among the nations, but he will come to ruin at last."

verses.name: Numbers 24:21
verses.text: Then he saw the Kenites and uttered his oracle: "Your dwelling place is secure, your nest is set in a rock;

verses.name: Numbers 24:22
verses.text: yet you Kenites will be destroyed when Asshur takes you captive."

verses.name: Numbers 24:23
verses.text: Then he uttered his oracle: "Ah, who can live when God does this?

verses.name: Numbers 24:24
verses.text: Ships will come from the shores of Kittim; they will subdue Asshur and Eber, but they too will come to ruin."

verses.name: Numbers 24:25
verses.text: Then Balaam got up and returned home and Balak went his own way.

verses.name: Numbers 25:1
verses.text: While Israel was staying in Shittim, the men began to indulge in sexual immorality with Moabite women,

verses.name: Numbers 25:2
verses.text: who invited them to the sacrifices to their gods. The people ate and bowed down before these gods.

verses.name: Numbers 25:3
verses.text: So Israel joined in worshiping the Baal of Peor. And the LORD's anger burned against them.

verses.name: Numbers 25:4
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses, "Take all the leaders of these people, kill them and expose them in broad daylight before the LORD, so that the LORD's fierce anger may turn away from Israel."

verses.name: Numbers 25:5
verses.text: So Moses said to Israel's judges, "Each of you must put to death those of your men who have joined in worshiping the Baal of Peor."

verses.name: Numbers 25:6
verses.text: Then an Israelite man brought to his family a Midianite woman right before the eyes of Moses and the whole assembly of Israel while they were weeping at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.

verses.name: Numbers 25:7
verses.text: When Phinehas son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron, the priest, saw this, he left the assembly, took a spear in his hand

verses.name: Numbers 25:8
verses.text: and followed the Israelite into the tent. He drove the spear through both of them-through the Israelite and into the woman's body. Then the plague against the Israelites was stopped;

verses.name: Numbers 25:9
verses.text: but those who died in the plague numbered 24,000.

verses.name: Numbers 25:10
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses,

verses.name: Numbers 25:11
verses.text: "Phinehas son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron, the priest, has turned my anger away from the Israelites; for he was as zealous as I am for my honor among them, so that in my zeal I did not put an end to them.

verses.name: Numbers 25:12
verses.text: Therefore tell him I am making my covenant of peace with him.

verses.name: Numbers 25:13
verses.text: He and his descendants will have a covenant of a lasting priesthood, because he was zealous for the honor of his God and made atonement for the Israelites."

verses.name: Numbers 25:14
verses.text: The name of the Israelite who was killed with the Midianite woman was Zimri son of Salu, the leader of a Simeonite family.

verses.name: Numbers 25:15
verses.text: And the name of the Midianite woman who was put to death was Cozbi daughter of Zur, a tribal chief of a Midianite family.

verses.name: Numbers 25:16
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses,

verses.name: Numbers 25:17
verses.text: "Treat the Midianites as enemies and kill them,

verses.name: Numbers 25:18
verses.text: because they treated you as enemies when they deceived you in the affair of Peor and their sister Cozbi, the daughter of a Midianite leader, the woman who was killed when the plague came as a result of Peor."

verses.name: Numbers 26:1
verses.text: After the plague the LORD said to Moses and Eleazar son of Aaron, the priest,

verses.name: Numbers 26:2
verses.text: "Take a census of the whole Israelite community by families-all those twenty years old or more who are able to serve in the army of Israel."

verses.name: Numbers 26:3
verses.text: So on the plains of Moab by the Jordan across from Jericho, Moses and Eleazar the priest spoke with them and said,

verses.name: Numbers 26:4
verses.text: "Take a census of the men twenty years old or more, as the LORD commanded Moses." These were the Israelites who came out of Egypt:

verses.name: Numbers 26:5
verses.text: The descendants of Reuben, the firstborn son of Israel, were: through Hanoch, the Hanochite clan; through Pallu, the Palluite clan;

verses.name: Numbers 26:6
verses.text: through Hezron, the Hezronite clan; through Carmi, the Carmite clan.

verses.name: Numbers 26:7
verses.text: These were the clans of Reuben; those numbered were 43,730.

verses.name: Numbers 26:8
verses.text: The son of Pallu was Eliab,

verses.name: Numbers 26:9
verses.text: and the sons of Eliab were Nemuel, Dathan and Abiram. The same Dathan and Abiram were the community officials who rebelled against Moses and Aaron and were among Korah's followers when they rebelled against the LORD.

verses.name: Numbers 26:10
verses.text: The earth opened its mouth and swallowed them along with Korah, whose followers died when the fire devoured the 250 men. And they served as a warning sign.

verses.name: Numbers 26:11
verses.text: The line of Korah, however, did not die out.

verses.name: Numbers 26:12
verses.text: The descendants of Simeon by their clans were: through Nemuel, the Nemuelite clan; through Jamin, the Jaminite clan; through Jakin, the Jakinite clan;

verses.name: Numbers 26:13
verses.text: through Zerah, the Zerahite clan; through Shaul, the Shaulite clan.

verses.name: Numbers 26:14
verses.text: These were the clans of Simeon; there were 22,200 men.

verses.name: Numbers 26:15
verses.text: The descendants of Gad by their clans were: through Zephon, the Zephonite clan; through Haggi, the Haggite clan; through Shuni, the Shunite clan;

verses.name: Numbers 26:16
verses.text: through Ozni, the Oznite clan; through Eri, the Erite clan;

verses.name: Numbers 26:17
verses.text: through Arodi, the Arodite clan; through Areli, the Arelite clan.

verses.name: Numbers 26:18
verses.text: These were the clans of Gad; those numbered were 40,500.

verses.name: Numbers 26:19
verses.text: Er and Onan were sons of Judah, but they died in Canaan.

verses.name: Numbers 26:20
verses.text: The descendants of Judah by their clans were: through Shelah, the Shelanite clan; through Perez, the Perezite clan; through Zerah, the Zerahite clan.

verses.name: Numbers 26:21
verses.text: The descendants of Perez were: through Hezron, the Hezronite clan; through Hamul, the Hamulite clan.

verses.name: Numbers 26:22
verses.text: These were the clans of Judah; those numbered were 76,500.

verses.name: Numbers 26:23
verses.text: The descendants of Issachar by their clans were: through Tola, the Tolaite clan; through Puah, the Puite clan;

verses.name: Numbers 26:24
verses.text: through Jashub, the Jashubite clan; through Shimron, the Shimronite clan.

verses.name: Numbers 26:25
verses.text: These were the clans of Issachar; those numbered were 64,300.

verses.name: Numbers 26:26
verses.text: The descendants of Zebulun by their clans were: through Sered, the Seredite clan; through Elon, the Elonite clan; through Jahleel, the Jahleelite clan.

verses.name: Numbers 26:27
verses.text: These were the clans of Zebulun; those numbered were 60,500.

verses.name: Numbers 26:28
verses.text: The descendants of Joseph by their clans through Manasseh and Ephraim were:

verses.name: Numbers 26:29
verses.text: The descendants of Manasseh: through Makir, the Makirite clan (Makir was the father of Gilead); through Gilead, the Gileadite clan.

verses.name: Numbers 26:30
verses.text: These were the descendants of Gilead: through Iezer, the Iezerite clan; through Helek, the Helekite clan;

verses.name: Numbers 26:31
verses.text: through Asriel, the Asrielite clan; through Shechem, the Shechemite clan;

verses.name: Numbers 26:32
verses.text: through Shemida, the Shemidaite clan; through Hepher, the Hepherite clan.

verses.name: Numbers 26:33
verses.text: (Zelophehad son of Hepher had no sons; he had only daughters, whose names were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah and Tirzah.)

verses.name: Numbers 26:34
verses.text: These were the clans of Manasseh; those numbered were 52,700.

verses.name: Numbers 26:35
verses.text: These were the descendants of Ephraim by their clans: through Shuthelah, the Shuthelahite clan; through Beker, the Bekerite clan; through Tahan, the Tahanite clan.

verses.name: Numbers 26:36
verses.text: These were the descendants of Shuthelah: through Eran, the Eranite clan.

verses.name: Numbers 26:37
verses.text: These were the clans of Ephraim; those numbered were 32,500. These were the descendants of Joseph by their clans.

verses.name: Numbers 26:38
verses.text: The descendants of Benjamin by their clans were: through Bela, the Belaite clan; through Ashbel, the Ashbelite clan; through Ahiram, the Ahiramite clan;

verses.name: Numbers 26:39
verses.text: through Shupham, the Shuphamite clan; through Hupham, the Huphamite clan.

verses.name: Numbers 26:40
verses.text: The descendants of Bela through Ard and Naaman were: through Ard, the Ardite clan; through Naaman, the Naamite clan.

verses.name: Numbers 26:41
verses.text: These were the clans of Benjamin; those numbered were 45,600.

verses.name: Numbers 26:42
verses.text: These were the descendants of Dan by their clans: through Shuham, the Shuhamite clan. These were the clans of Dan:

verses.name: Numbers 26:43
verses.text: All of them were Shuhamite clans; and those numbered were 64,400.

verses.name: Numbers 26:44
verses.text: The descendants of Asher by their clans were: through Imnah, the Imnite clan; through Ishvi, the Ishvite clan; through Beriah, the Beriite clan;

verses.name: Numbers 26:45
verses.text: and through the descendants of Beriah: through Heber, the Heberite clan; through Malkiel, the Malkielite clan.

verses.name: Numbers 26:46
verses.text: (Asher had a daughter named Serah.)

verses.name: Numbers 26:47
verses.text: These were the clans of Asher; those numbered were 53,400.

verses.name: Numbers 26:48
verses.text: The descendants of Naphtali by their clans were: through Jahzeel, the Jahzeelite clan; through Guni, the Gunite clan;

verses.name: Numbers 26:49
verses.text: through Jezer, the Jezerite clan; through Shillem, the Shillemite clan.

verses.name: Numbers 26:50
verses.text: These were the clans of Naphtali; those numbered were 45,400.

verses.name: Numbers 26:51
verses.text: The total number of the men of Israel was 601,730.

verses.name: Numbers 26:52
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses,

verses.name: Numbers 26:53
verses.text: "The land is to be allotted to them as an inheritance based on the number of names.

verses.name: Numbers 26:54
verses.text: To a larger group give a larger inheritance, and to a smaller group a smaller one; each is to receive its inheritance according to the number of those listed.

verses.name: Numbers 26:55
verses.text: Be sure that the land is distributed by lot. What each group inherits will be according to the names for its ancestral tribe.

verses.name: Numbers 26:56
verses.text: Each inheritance is to be distributed by lot among the larger and smaller groups."

verses.name: Numbers 26:57
verses.text: These were the Levites who were counted by their clans: through Gershon, the Gershonite clan; through Kohath, the Kohathite clan; through Merari, the Merarite clan.

verses.name: Numbers 26:58
verses.text: These also were Levite clans: the Libnite clan, the Hebronite clan, the Mahlite clan, the Mushite clan, the Korahite clan. (Kohath was the forefather of Amram;

verses.name: Numbers 26:59
verses.text: the name of Amram's wife was Jochebed, a descendant of Levi, who was born to the Levites in Egypt. To Amram she bore Aaron, Moses and their sister Miriam.

verses.name: Numbers 26:60
verses.text: Aaron was the father of Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.

verses.name: Numbers 26:61
verses.text: But Nadab and Abihu died when they made an offering before the LORD with unauthorized fire.)

verses.name: Numbers 26:62
verses.text: All the male Levites a month old or more numbered 23,000. They were not counted along with the other Israelites because they received no inheritance among them.

verses.name: Numbers 26:63
verses.text: These are the ones counted by Moses and Eleazar the priest when they counted the Israelites on the plains of Moab by the Jordan across from Jericho.

verses.name: Numbers 26:64
verses.text: Not one of them was among those counted by Moses and Aaron the priest when they counted the Israelites in the Desert of Sinai.

verses.name: Numbers 26:65
verses.text: For the LORD had told those Israelites they would surely die in the desert, and not one of them was left except Caleb son of Jephunneh and Joshua son of Nun.

verses.name: Numbers 27:1
verses.text: The daughters of Zelophehad son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Makir, the son of Manasseh, belonged to the clans of Manasseh son of Joseph. The names of the daughters were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah and Tirzah. They approached

verses.name: Numbers 27:2
verses.text: the entrance to the Tent of Meeting and stood before Moses, Eleazar the priest, the leaders and the whole assembly, and said,

verses.name: Numbers 27:3
verses.text: "Our father died in the desert. He was not among Korah's followers, who banded together against the LORD, but he died for his own sin and left no sons.

verses.name: Numbers 27:4
verses.text: Why should our father's name disappear from his clan because he had no son? Give us property among our father's relatives."

verses.name: Numbers 27:5
verses.text: So Moses brought their case before the LORD

verses.name: Numbers 27:6
verses.text: and the LORD said to him,

verses.name: Numbers 27:7
verses.text: "What Zelophehad's daughters are saying is right. You must certainly give them property as an inheritance among their father's relatives and turn their father's inheritance over to them.

verses.name: Numbers 27:8
verses.text: "Say to the Israelites, 'If a man dies and leaves no son, turn his inheritance over to his daughter.

verses.name: Numbers 27:9
verses.text: If he has no daughter, give his inheritance to his brothers.

verses.name: Numbers 27:10
verses.text: If he has no brothers, give his inheritance to his father's brothers.

verses.name: Numbers 27:11
verses.text: If his father had no brothers, give his inheritance to the nearest relative in his clan, that he may possess it. This is to be a legal requirement for the Israelites, as the LORD commanded Moses.'"

verses.name: Numbers 27:12
verses.text: Then the LORD said to Moses, "Go up this mountain in the Abarim range and see the land I have given the Israelites.

verses.name: Numbers 27:13
verses.text: After you have seen it, you too will be gathered to your people, as your brother Aaron was,

verses.name: Numbers 27:14
verses.text: for when the community rebelled at the waters in the Desert of Zin, both of you disobeyed my command to honor me as holy before their eyes." (These were the waters of Meribah Kadesh, in the Desert of Zin.)

verses.name: Numbers 27:15
verses.text: Moses said to the LORD,

verses.name: Numbers 27:16
verses.text: "May the LORD, the God of the spirits of all mankind, appoint a man over this community

verses.name: Numbers 27:17
verses.text: to go out and come in before them, one who will lead them out and bring them in, so the LORD's people will not be like sheep without a shepherd."

verses.name: Numbers 27:18
verses.text: So the LORD said to Moses, "Take Joshua son of Nun, a man in whom is the spirit, and lay your hand on him.

verses.name: Numbers 27:19
verses.text: Have him stand before Eleazar the priest and the entire assembly and commission him in their presence.

verses.name: Numbers 27:20
verses.text: Give him some of your authority so the whole Israelite community will obey him.

verses.name: Numbers 27:21
verses.text: He is to stand before Eleazar the priest, who will obtain decisions for him by inquiring of the Urim before the LORD. At his command he and the entire community of the Israelites will go out, and at his command they will come in."

verses.name: Numbers 27:22
verses.text: Moses did as the LORD commanded him. He took Joshua and had him stand before Eleazar the priest and the whole assembly.

verses.name: Numbers 27:23
verses.text: Then he laid his hands on him and commissioned him, as the LORD instructed through Moses.

verses.name: Numbers 28:1
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses,

verses.name: Numbers 28:2
verses.text: "Give this command to the Israelites and say to them: 'See that you present to me at the appointed time the food for my offerings made by fire, as an aroma pleasing to me.'

verses.name: Numbers 28:3
verses.text: Say to them: 'This is the offering made by fire that you are to present to the LORD: two lambs a year old without defect, as a regular burnt offering each day.

verses.name: Numbers 28:4
verses.text: Prepare one lamb in the morning and the other at twilight,

verses.name: Numbers 28:5
verses.text: together with a grain offering of a tenth of an ephah of fine flour mixed with a quarter of a hin of oil from pressed olives.

verses.name: Numbers 28:6
verses.text: This is the regular burnt offering instituted at Mount Sinai as a pleasing aroma, an offering made to the LORD by fire.

verses.name: Numbers 28:7
verses.text: The accompanying drink offering is to be a quarter of a hin of fermented drink with each lamb. Pour out the drink offering to the LORD at the sanctuary.

verses.name: Numbers 28:8
verses.text: Prepare the second lamb at twilight, along with the same kind of grain offering and drink offering that you prepare in the morning. This is an offering made by fire, an aroma pleasing to the LORD.

verses.name: Numbers 28:9
verses.text: "'On the Sabbath day, make an offering of two lambs a year old without defect, together with its drink offering and a grain offering of two-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil.

verses.name: Numbers 28:10
verses.text: This is the burnt offering for every Sabbath, in addition to the regular burnt offering and its drink offering.

verses.name: Numbers 28:11
verses.text: "'On the first of every month, present to the LORD a burnt offering of two young bulls, one ram and seven male lambs a year old, all without defect.

verses.name: Numbers 28:12
verses.text: With each bull there is to be a grain offering of three-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil; with the ram, a grain offering of two-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil;

verses.name: Numbers 28:13
verses.text: and with each lamb, a grain offering of a tenth of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil. This is for a burnt offering, a pleasing aroma, an offering made to the LORD by fire.

verses.name: Numbers 28:14
verses.text: With each bull there is to be a drink offering of half a hin of wine; with the ram, a third of a hin; and with each lamb, a quarter of a hin. This is the monthly burnt offering to be made at each new moon during the year.

verses.name: Numbers 28:15
verses.text: Besides the regular burnt offering with its drink offering, one male goat is to be presented to the LORD as a sin offering.

verses.name: Numbers 28:16
verses.text: "'On the fourteenth day of the first month the LORD's Passover is to be held.

verses.name: Numbers 28:17
verses.text: On the fifteenth day of this month there is to be a festival; for seven days eat bread made without yeast.

verses.name: Numbers 28:18
verses.text: On the first day hold a sacred assembly and do no regular work.

verses.name: Numbers 28:19
verses.text: Present to the LORD an offering made by fire, a burnt offering of two young bulls, one ram and seven male lambs a year old, all without defect.

verses.name: Numbers 28:20
verses.text: With each bull prepare a grain offering of three-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil; with the ram, two-tenths;

verses.name: Numbers 28:21
verses.text: and with each of the seven lambs, one-tenth.

verses.name: Numbers 28:22
verses.text: Include one male goat as a sin offering to make atonement for you.

verses.name: Numbers 28:23
verses.text: Prepare these in addition to the regular morning burnt offering.

verses.name: Numbers 28:24
verses.text: In this way prepare the food for the offering made by fire every day for seven days as an aroma pleasing to the LORD; it is to be prepared in addition to the regular burnt offering and its drink offering.

verses.name: Numbers 28:25
verses.text: On the seventh day hold a sacred assembly and do no regular work.
