verses.name: Numbers 28:26
verses.text: "'On the day of firstfruits, when you present to the LORD an offering of new grain during the Feast of Weeks, hold a sacred assembly and do no regular work.

verses.name: Numbers 28:27
verses.text: Present a burnt offering of two young bulls, one ram and seven male lambs a year old as an aroma pleasing to the LORD.

verses.name: Numbers 28:28
verses.text: With each bull there is to be a grain offering of three-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil; with the ram, two-tenths;

verses.name: Numbers 28:29
verses.text: and with each of the seven lambs, one-tenth.

verses.name: Numbers 28:30
verses.text: Include one male goat to make atonement for you.

verses.name: Numbers 28:31
verses.text: Prepare these together with their drink offerings, in addition to the regular burnt offering and its grain offering. Be sure the animals are without defect.

verses.name: Numbers 29:1
verses.text: "'On the first day of the seventh month hold a sacred assembly and do no regular work. It is a day for you to sound the trumpets.

verses.name: Numbers 29:2
verses.text: As an aroma pleasing to the LORD, prepare a burnt offering of one young bull, one ram and seven male lambs a year old, all without defect.

verses.name: Numbers 29:3
verses.text: With the bull prepare a grain offering of three-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil; with the ram, two-tenths;

verses.name: Numbers 29:4
verses.text: and with each of the seven lambs, one-tenth.

verses.name: Numbers 29:5
verses.text: Include one male goat as a sin offering to make atonement for you.

verses.name: Numbers 29:6
verses.text: These are in addition to the monthly and daily burnt offerings with their grain offerings and drink offerings as specified. They are offerings made to the LORD by fire-a pleasing aroma.

verses.name: Numbers 29:7
verses.text: "'On the tenth day of this seventh month hold a sacred assembly. You must deny yourselves and do no work.

verses.name: Numbers 29:8
verses.text: Present as an aroma pleasing to the LORD a burnt offering of one young bull, one ram and seven male lambs a year old, all without defect.

verses.name: Numbers 29:9
verses.text: With the bull prepare a grain offering of three-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil; with the ram, two-tenths;

verses.name: Numbers 29:10
verses.text: and with each of the seven lambs, one-tenth.

verses.name: Numbers 29:11
verses.text: Include one male goat as a sin offering, in addition to the sin offering for atonement and the regular burnt offering with its grain offering, and their drink offerings.

verses.name: Numbers 29:12
verses.text: "'On the fifteenth day of the seventh month, hold a sacred assembly and do no regular work. Celebrate a festival to the LORD for seven days.

verses.name: Numbers 29:13
verses.text: Present an offering made by fire as an aroma pleasing to the LORD, a burnt offering of thirteen young bulls, two rams and fourteen male lambs a year old, all without defect.

verses.name: Numbers 29:14
verses.text: With each of the thirteen bulls prepare a grain offering of three-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil; with each of the two rams, two-tenths;

verses.name: Numbers 29:15
verses.text: and with each of the fourteen lambs, one-tenth.

verses.name: Numbers 29:16
verses.text: Include one male goat as a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering with its grain offering and drink offering.

verses.name: Numbers 29:17
verses.text: "'On the second day prepare twelve young bulls, two rams and fourteen male lambs a year old, all without defect.

verses.name: Numbers 29:18
verses.text: With the bulls, rams and lambs, prepare their grain offerings and drink offerings according to the number specified.

verses.name: Numbers 29:19
verses.text: Include one male goat as a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering with its grain offering, and their drink offerings.

verses.name: Numbers 29:20
verses.text: "'On the third day prepare eleven bulls, two rams and fourteen male lambs a year old, all without defect.

verses.name: Numbers 29:21
verses.text: With the bulls, rams and lambs, prepare their grain offerings and drink offerings according to the number specified.

verses.name: Numbers 29:22
verses.text: Include one male goat as a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering with its grain offering and drink offering.

verses.name: Numbers 29:23
verses.text: "'On the fourth day prepare ten bulls, two rams and fourteen male lambs a year old, all without defect.

verses.name: Numbers 29:24
verses.text: With the bulls, rams and lambs, prepare their grain offerings and drink offerings according to the number specified.

verses.name: Numbers 29:25
verses.text: Include one male goat as a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering with its grain offering and drink offering.

verses.name: Numbers 29:26
verses.text: "'On the fifth day prepare nine bulls, two rams and fourteen male lambs a year old, all without defect.

verses.name: Numbers 29:27
verses.text: With the bulls, rams and lambs, prepare their grain offerings and drink offerings according to the number specified.

verses.name: Numbers 29:28
verses.text: Include one male goat as a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering with its grain offering and drink offering.

verses.name: Numbers 29:29
verses.text: "'On the sixth day prepare eight bulls, two rams and fourteen male lambs a year old, all without defect.

verses.name: Numbers 29:30
verses.text: With the bulls, rams and lambs, prepare their grain offerings and drink offerings according to the number specified.

verses.name: Numbers 29:31
verses.text: Include one male goat as a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering with its grain offering and drink offering.

verses.name: Numbers 29:32
verses.text: "'On the seventh day prepare seven bulls, two rams and fourteen male lambs a year old, all without defect.

verses.name: Numbers 29:33
verses.text: With the bulls, rams and lambs, prepare their grain offerings and drink offerings according to the number specified.

verses.name: Numbers 29:34
verses.text: Include one male goat as a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering with its grain offering and drink offering.

verses.name: Numbers 29:35
verses.text: "'On the eighth day hold an assembly and do no regular work.

verses.name: Numbers 29:36
verses.text: Present an offering made by fire as an aroma pleasing to the LORD, a burnt offering of one bull, one ram and seven male lambs a year old, all without defect.

verses.name: Numbers 29:37
verses.text: With the bull, the ram and the lambs, prepare their grain offerings and drink offerings according to the number specified.

verses.name: Numbers 29:38
verses.text: Include one male goat as a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering with its grain offering and drink offering.

verses.name: Numbers 29:39
verses.text: "'In addition to what you vow and your freewill offerings, prepare these for the LORD at your appointed feasts: your burnt offerings, grain offerings, drink offerings and fellowship offerings. '"

verses.name: Numbers 29:40
verses.text: Moses told the Israelites all that the LORD commanded him.

verses.name: Numbers 30:1
verses.text: Moses said to the heads of the tribes of Israel: "This is what the LORD commands:

verses.name: Numbers 30:2
verses.text: When a man makes a vow to the LORD or takes an oath to obligate himself by a pledge, he must not break his word but must do everything he said.

verses.name: Numbers 30:3
verses.text: "When a young woman still living in her father's house makes a vow to the LORD or obligates herself by a pledge

verses.name: Numbers 30:4
verses.text: and her father hears about her vow or pledge but says nothing to her, then all her vows and every pledge by which she obligated herself will stand.

verses.name: Numbers 30:5
verses.text: But if her father forbids her when he hears about it, none of her vows or the pledges by which she obligated herself will stand; the LORD will release her because her father has forbidden her.

verses.name: Numbers 30:6
verses.text: "If she marries after she makes a vow or after her lips utter a rash promise by which she obligates herself

verses.name: Numbers 30:7
verses.text: and her husband hears about it but says nothing to her, then her vows or the pledges by which she obligated herself will stand.

verses.name: Numbers 30:8
verses.text: But if her husband forbids her when he hears about it, he nullifies the vow that obligates her or the rash promise by which she obligates herself, and the LORD will release her.

verses.name: Numbers 30:9
verses.text: "Any vow or obligation taken by a widow or divorced woman will be binding on her.

verses.name: Numbers 30:10
verses.text: "If a woman living with her husband makes a vow or obligates herself by a pledge under oath

verses.name: Numbers 30:11
verses.text: and her husband hears about it but says nothing to her and does not forbid her, then all her vows or the pledges by which she obligated herself will stand.

verses.name: Numbers 30:12
verses.text: But if her husband nullifies them when he hears about them, then none of the vows or pledges that came from her lips will stand. Her husband has nullified them, and the LORD will release her.

verses.name: Numbers 30:13
verses.text: Her husband may confirm or nullify any vow she makes or any sworn pledge to deny herself.

verses.name: Numbers 30:14
verses.text: But if her husband says nothing to her about it from day to day, then he confirms all her vows or the pledges binding on her. He confirms them by saying nothing to her when he hears about them.

verses.name: Numbers 30:15
verses.text: If, however, he nullifies them some time after he hears about them, then he is responsible for her guilt."

verses.name: Numbers 30:16
verses.text: These are the regulations the LORD gave Moses concerning relationships between a man and his wife, and between a father and his young daughter still living in his house.

verses.name: Numbers 31:1
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses,

verses.name: Numbers 31:2
verses.text: "Take vengeance on the Midianites for the Israelites. After that, you will be gathered to your people."

verses.name: Numbers 31:3
verses.text: So Moses said to the people, "Arm some of your men to go to war against the Midianites and to carry out the LORD's vengeance on them.

verses.name: Numbers 31:4
verses.text: Send into battle a thousand men from each of the tribes of Israel."

verses.name: Numbers 31:5
verses.text: So twelve thousand men armed for battle, a thousand from each tribe, were supplied from the clans of Israel.

verses.name: Numbers 31:6
verses.text: Moses sent them into battle, a thousand from each tribe, along with Phinehas son of Eleazar, the priest, who took with him articles from the sanctuary and the trumpets for signaling.

verses.name: Numbers 31:7
verses.text: They fought against Midian, as the LORD commanded Moses, and killed every man.

verses.name: Numbers 31:8
verses.text: Among their victims were Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur and Reba-the five kings of Midian. They also killed Balaam son of Beor with the sword.

verses.name: Numbers 31:9
verses.text: The Israelites captured the Midianite women and children and took all the Midianite herds, flocks and goods as plunder.

verses.name: Numbers 31:10
verses.text: They burned all the towns where the Midianites had settled, as well as all their camps.

verses.name: Numbers 31:11
verses.text: They took all the plunder and spoils, including the people and animals,

verses.name: Numbers 31:12
verses.text: and brought the captives, spoils and plunder to Moses and Eleazar the priest and the Israelite assembly at their camp on the plains of Moab, by the Jordan across from Jericho.

verses.name: Numbers 31:13
verses.text: Moses, Eleazar the priest and all the leaders of the community went to meet them outside the camp.

verses.name: Numbers 31:14
verses.text: Moses was angry with the officers of the army-the commanders of thousands and commanders of hundreds-who returned from the battle.

verses.name: Numbers 31:15
verses.text: "Have you allowed all the women to live?" he asked them.

verses.name: Numbers 31:16
verses.text: "They were the ones who followed Balaam's advice and were the means of turning the Israelites away from the LORD in what happened at Peor, so that a plague struck the LORD's people.

verses.name: Numbers 31:17
verses.text: Now kill all the boys. And kill every woman who has slept with a man,

verses.name: Numbers 31:18
verses.text: but save for yourselves every girl who has never slept with a man.

verses.name: Numbers 31:19
verses.text: "All of you who have killed anyone or touched anyone who was killed must stay outside the camp seven days. On the third and seventh days you must purify yourselves and your captives.

verses.name: Numbers 31:20
verses.text: Purify every garment as well as everything made of leather, goat hair or wood."

verses.name: Numbers 31:21
verses.text: Then Eleazar the priest said to the soldiers who had gone into battle, "This is the requirement of the law that the LORD gave Moses:

verses.name: Numbers 31:22
verses.text: Gold, silver, bronze, iron, tin, lead

verses.name: Numbers 31:23
verses.text: and anything else that can withstand fire must be put through the fire, and then it will be clean. But it must also be purified with the water of cleansing. And whatever cannot withstand fire must be put through that water.

verses.name: Numbers 31:24
verses.text: On the seventh day wash your clothes and you will be clean. Then you may come into the camp."

verses.name: Numbers 31:25
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses,

verses.name: Numbers 31:26
verses.text: "You and Eleazar the priest and the family heads of the community are to count all the people and animals that were captured.

verses.name: Numbers 31:27
verses.text: Divide the spoils between the soldiers who took part in the battle and the rest of the community.

verses.name: Numbers 31:28
verses.text: From the soldiers who fought in the battle, set apart as tribute for the LORD one out of every five hundred, whether persons, cattle, donkeys, sheep or goats.

verses.name: Numbers 31:29
verses.text: Take this tribute from their half share and give it to Eleazar the priest as the LORD's part.

verses.name: Numbers 31:30
verses.text: From the Israelites' half, select one out of every fifty, whether persons, cattle, donkeys, sheep, goats or other animals. Give them to the Levites, who are responsible for the care of the LORD's tabernacle."

verses.name: Numbers 31:31
verses.text: So Moses and Eleazar the priest did as the LORD commanded Moses.

verses.name: Numbers 31:32
verses.text: The plunder remaining from the spoils that the soldiers took was 675,000 sheep,

verses.name: Numbers 31:33
verses.text: 72,000 cattle,

verses.name: Numbers 31:34
verses.text: 61,000 donkeys

verses.name: Numbers 31:35
verses.text: and 32,000 women who had never slept with a man.

verses.name: Numbers 31:36
verses.text: The half share of those who fought in the battle was: 337,500 sheep,

verses.name: Numbers 31:37
verses.text: of which the tribute for the LORD was 675;

verses.name: Numbers 31:38
verses.text: 36,000 cattle, of which the tribute for the LORD was 72;

verses.name: Numbers 31:39
verses.text: 30,500 donkeys, of which the tribute for the LORD was 61;

verses.name: Numbers 31:40
verses.text: 16,000 people, of which the tribute for the LORD was 32.

verses.name: Numbers 31:41
verses.text: Moses gave the tribute to Eleazar the priest as the LORD's part, as the LORD commanded Moses.

verses.name: Numbers 31:42
verses.text: The half belonging to the Israelites, which Moses set apart from that of the fighting men-

verses.name: Numbers 31:43
verses.text: the community's half-was 337,500 sheep,

verses.name: Numbers 31:44
verses.text: 36,000 cattle,

verses.name: Numbers 31:45
verses.text: 30,500 donkeys

verses.name: Numbers 31:46
verses.text: and 16,000 people.

verses.name: Numbers 31:47
verses.text: From the Israelites' half, Moses selected one out of every fifty persons and animals, as the LORD commanded him, and gave them to the Levites, who were responsible for the care of the LORD's tabernacle.

verses.name: Numbers 31:48
verses.text: Then the officers who were over the units of the army-the commanders of thousands and commanders of hundreds-went to Moses

verses.name: Numbers 31:49
verses.text: and said to him, "Your servants have counted the soldiers under our command, and not one is missing.

verses.name: Numbers 31:50
verses.text: So we have brought as an offering to the LORD the gold articles each of us acquired-armlets, bracelets, signet rings, earrings and necklaces-to make atonement for ourselves before the LORD."

verses.name: Numbers 31:51
verses.text: Moses and Eleazar the priest accepted from them the gold-all the crafted articles.

verses.name: Numbers 31:52
verses.text: All the gold from the commanders of thousands and commanders of hundreds that Moses and Eleazar presented as a gift to the LORD weighed 16,750 shekels.

verses.name: Numbers 31:53
verses.text: Each soldier had taken plunder for himself.

verses.name: Numbers 31:54
verses.text: Moses and Eleazar the priest accepted the gold from the commanders of thousands and commanders of hundreds and brought it into the Tent of Meeting as a memorial for the Israelites before the LORD.

verses.name: Numbers 32:1
verses.text: The Reubenites and Gadites, who had very large herds and flocks, saw that the lands of Jazer and Gilead were suitable for livestock.

verses.name: Numbers 32:2
verses.text: So they came to Moses and Eleazar the priest and to the leaders of the community, and said,

verses.name: Numbers 32:3
verses.text: "Ataroth, Dibon, Jazer, Nimrah, Heshbon, Elealeh, Sebam, Nebo and Beon-

verses.name: Numbers 32:4
verses.text: the land the LORD subdued before the people of Israel-are suitable for livestock, and your servants have livestock.

verses.name: Numbers 32:5
verses.text: If we have found favor in your eyes," they said, "let this land be given to your servants as our possession. Do not make us cross the Jordan."

verses.name: Numbers 32:6
verses.text: Moses said to the Gadites and Reubenites, "Shall your countrymen go to war while you sit here?

verses.name: Numbers 32:7
verses.text: Why do you discourage the Israelites from going over into the land the LORD has given them?

verses.name: Numbers 32:8
verses.text: This is what your fathers did when I sent them from Kadesh Barnea to look over the land.

verses.name: Numbers 32:9
verses.text: After they went up to the Valley of Eshcol and viewed the land, they discouraged the Israelites from entering the land the LORD had given them.

verses.name: Numbers 32:10
verses.text: The LORD's anger was aroused that day and he swore this oath:

verses.name: Numbers 32:11
verses.text: 'Because they have not followed me wholeheartedly, not one of the men twenty years old or more who came up out of Egypt will see the land I promised on oath to Abraham, Isaac and Jacob-

verses.name: Numbers 32:12
verses.text: not one except Caleb son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite and Joshua son of Nun, for they followed the LORD wholeheartedly.'

verses.name: Numbers 32:13
verses.text: The LORD's anger burned against Israel and he made them wander in the desert forty years, until the whole generation of those who had done evil in his sight was gone.

verses.name: Numbers 32:14
verses.text: "And here you are, a brood of sinners, standing in the place of your fathers and making the LORD even more angry with Israel.

verses.name: Numbers 32:15
verses.text: If you turn away from following him, he will again leave all this people in the desert, and you will be the cause of their destruction."

verses.name: Numbers 32:16
verses.text: Then they came up to him and said, "We would like to build pens here for our livestock and cities for our women and children.

verses.name: Numbers 32:17
verses.text: But we are ready to arm ourselves and go ahead of the Israelites until we have brought them to their place. Meanwhile our women and children will live in fortified cities, for protection from the inhabitants of the land.

verses.name: Numbers 32:18
verses.text: We will not return to our homes until every Israelite has received his inheritance.

verses.name: Numbers 32:19
verses.text: We will not receive any inheritance with them on the other side of the Jordan, because our inheritance has come to us on the east side of the Jordan."

verses.name: Numbers 32:20
verses.text: Then Moses said to them, "If you will do this-if you will arm yourselves before the LORD for battle,

verses.name: Numbers 32:21
verses.text: and if all of you will go armed over the Jordan before the LORD until he has driven his enemies out before him-

verses.name: Numbers 32:22
verses.text: then when the land is subdued before the LORD, you may return and be free from your obligation to the LORD and to Israel. And this land will be your possession before the LORD.

verses.name: Numbers 32:23
verses.text: "But if you fail to do this, you will be sinning against the LORD; and you may be sure that your sin will find you out.

verses.name: Numbers 32:24
verses.text: Build cities for your women and children, and pens for your flocks, but do what you have promised."

verses.name: Numbers 32:25
verses.text: The Gadites and Reubenites said to Moses, "We your servants will do as our lord commands.

verses.name: Numbers 32:26
verses.text: Our children and wives, our flocks and herds will remain here in the cities of Gilead.

verses.name: Numbers 32:27
verses.text: But your servants, every man armed for battle, will cross over to fight before the LORD, just as our lord says."

verses.name: Numbers 32:28
verses.text: Then Moses gave orders about them to Eleazar the priest and Joshua son of Nun and to the family heads of the Israelite tribes.

verses.name: Numbers 32:29
verses.text: He said to them, "If the Gadites and Reubenites, every man armed for battle, cross over the Jordan with you before the LORD, then when the land is subdued before you, give them the land of Gilead as their possession.

verses.name: Numbers 32:30
verses.text: But if they do not cross over with you armed, they must accept their possession with you in Canaan."

verses.name: Numbers 32:31
verses.text: The Gadites and Reubenites answered, "Your servants will do what the LORD has said.

verses.name: Numbers 32:32
verses.text: We will cross over before the LORD into Canaan armed, but the property we inherit will be on this side of the Jordan."

verses.name: Numbers 32:33
verses.text: Then Moses gave to the Gadites, the Reubenites and the half-tribe of Manasseh son of Joseph the kingdom of Sihon king of the Amorites and the kingdom of Og king of Bashan-the whole land with its cities and the territory around them.

verses.name: Numbers 32:34
verses.text: The Gadites built up Dibon, Ataroth, Aroer,

verses.name: Numbers 32:35
verses.text: Atroth Shophan, Jazer, Jogbehah,

verses.name: Numbers 32:36
verses.text: Beth Nimrah and Beth Haran as fortified cities, and built pens for their flocks.

verses.name: Numbers 32:37
verses.text: And the Reubenites rebuilt Heshbon, Elealeh and Kiriathaim,

verses.name: Numbers 32:38
verses.text: as well as Nebo and Baal Meon (these names were changed) and Sibmah. They gave names to the cities they rebuilt.

verses.name: Numbers 32:39
verses.text: The descendants of Makir son of Manasseh went to Gilead, captured it and drove out the Amorites who were there.

verses.name: Numbers 32:40
verses.text: So Moses gave Gilead to the Makirites, the descendants of Manasseh, and they settled there.

verses.name: Numbers 32:41
verses.text: Jair, a descendant of Manasseh, captured their settlements and called them Havvoth Jair.

verses.name: Numbers 32:42
verses.text: And Nobah captured Kenath and its surrounding settlements and called it Nobah after himself.

verses.name: Numbers 33:1
verses.text: Here are the stages in the journey of the Israelites when they came out of Egypt by divisions under the leadership of Moses and Aaron.

verses.name: Numbers 33:2
verses.text: At the LORD's command Moses recorded the stages in their journey. This is their journey by stages:

verses.name: Numbers 33:3
verses.text: The Israelites set out from Rameses on the fifteenth day of the first month, the day after the Passover. They marched out boldly in full view of all the Egyptians,

verses.name: Numbers 33:4
verses.text: who were burying all their firstborn, whom the LORD had struck down among them; for the LORD had brought judgment on their gods.

verses.name: Numbers 33:5
verses.text: The Israelites left Rameses and camped at Succoth.

verses.name: Numbers 33:6
verses.text: They left Succoth and camped at Etham, on the edge of the desert.

verses.name: Numbers 33:7
verses.text: They left Etham, turned back to Pi Hahiroth, to the east of Baal Zephon, and camped near Migdol.

verses.name: Numbers 33:8
verses.text: They left Pi Hahiroth and passed through the sea into the desert, and when they had traveled for three days in the Desert of Etham, they camped at Marah.

verses.name: Numbers 33:9
verses.text: They left Marah and went to Elim, where there were twelve springs and seventy palm trees, and they camped there.

verses.name: Numbers 33:10
verses.text: They left Elim and camped by the Red Sea.

verses.name: Numbers 33:11
verses.text: They left the Red Sea and camped in the Desert of Sin.

verses.name: Numbers 33:12
verses.text: They left the Desert of Sin and camped at Dophkah.

verses.name: Numbers 33:13
verses.text: They left Dophkah and camped at Alush.

verses.name: Numbers 33:14
verses.text: They left Alush and camped at Rephidim, where there was no water for the people to drink.

verses.name: Numbers 33:15
verses.text: They left Rephidim and camped in the Desert of Sinai.

verses.name: Numbers 33:16
verses.text: They left the Desert of Sinai and camped at Kibroth Hattaavah.

verses.name: Numbers 33:17
verses.text: They left Kibroth Hattaavah and camped at Hazeroth.

verses.name: Numbers 33:18
verses.text: They left Hazeroth and camped at Rithmah.

verses.name: Numbers 33:19
verses.text: They left Rithmah and camped at Rimmon Perez.

verses.name: Numbers 33:20
verses.text: They left Rimmon Perez and camped at Libnah.

verses.name: Numbers 33:21
verses.text: They left Libnah and camped at Rissah.

verses.name: Numbers 33:22
verses.text: They left Rissah and camped at Kehelathah.

verses.name: Numbers 33:23
verses.text: They left Kehelathah and camped at Mount Shepher.

verses.name: Numbers 33:24
verses.text: They left Mount Shepher and camped at Haradah.

verses.name: Numbers 33:25
verses.text: They left Haradah and camped at Makheloth.

verses.name: Numbers 33:26
verses.text: They left Makheloth and camped at Tahath.

verses.name: Numbers 33:27
verses.text: They left Tahath and camped at Terah.

verses.name: Numbers 33:28
verses.text: They left Terah and camped at Mithcah.

verses.name: Numbers 33:29
verses.text: They left Mithcah and camped at Hashmonah.

verses.name: Numbers 33:30
verses.text: They left Hashmonah and camped at Moseroth.

verses.name: Numbers 33:31
verses.text: They left Moseroth and camped at Bene Jaakan.

verses.name: Numbers 33:32
verses.text: They left Bene Jaakan and camped at Hor Haggidgad.

verses.name: Numbers 33:33
verses.text: They left Hor Haggidgad and camped at Jotbathah.

verses.name: Numbers 33:34
verses.text: They left Jotbathah and camped at Abronah.

verses.name: Numbers 33:35
verses.text: They left Abronah and camped at Ezion Geber.

verses.name: Numbers 33:36
verses.text: They left Ezion Geber and camped at Kadesh, in the Desert of Zin.

verses.name: Numbers 33:37
verses.text: They left Kadesh and camped at Mount Hor, on the border of Edom.

verses.name: Numbers 33:38
verses.text: At the LORD's command Aaron the priest went up Mount Hor, where he died on the first day of the fifth month of the fortieth year after the Israelites came out of Egypt.

verses.name: Numbers 33:39
verses.text: Aaron was a hundred and twenty-three years old when he died on Mount Hor.

verses.name: Numbers 33:40
verses.text: The Canaanite king of Arad, who lived in the Negev of Canaan, heard that the Israelites were coming.

verses.name: Numbers 33:41
verses.text: They left Mount Hor and camped at Zalmonah.

verses.name: Numbers 33:42
verses.text: They left Zalmonah and camped at Punon.

verses.name: Numbers 33:43
verses.text: They left Punon and camped at Oboth.

verses.name: Numbers 33:44
verses.text: They left Oboth and camped at Iye Abarim, on the border of Moab.

verses.name: Numbers 33:45
verses.text: They left Iyim and camped at Dibon Gad.

verses.name: Numbers 33:46
verses.text: They left Dibon Gad and camped at Almon Diblathaim.

verses.name: Numbers 33:47
verses.text: They left Almon Diblathaim and camped in the mountains of Abarim, near Nebo.

verses.name: Numbers 33:48
verses.text: They left the mountains of Abarim and camped on the plains of Moab by the Jordan across from Jericho.

verses.name: Numbers 33:49
verses.text: There on the plains of Moab they camped along the Jordan from Beth Jeshimoth to Abel Shittim.

verses.name: Numbers 33:50
verses.text: On the plains of Moab by the Jordan across from Jericho the LORD said to Moses,

verses.name: Numbers 33:51
verses.text: "Speak to the Israelites and say to them: 'When you cross the Jordan into Canaan,

verses.name: Numbers 33:52
verses.text: drive out all the inhabitants of the land before you. Destroy all their carved images and their cast idols, and demolish all their high places.

verses.name: Numbers 33:53
verses.text: Take possession of the land and settle in it, for I have given you the land to possess.

verses.name: Numbers 33:54
verses.text: Distribute the land by lot, according to your clans. To a larger group give a larger inheritance, and to a smaller group a smaller one. Whatever falls to them by lot will be theirs. Distribute it according to your ancestral tribes.

verses.name: Numbers 33:55
verses.text: "'But if you do not drive out the inhabitants of the land, those you allow to remain will become barbs in your eyes and thorns in your sides. They will give you trouble in the land where you will live.

verses.name: Numbers 33:56
verses.text: And then I will do to you what I plan to do to them.'"

verses.name: Numbers 34:1
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses,

verses.name: Numbers 34:2
verses.text: "Command the Israelites and say to them: 'When you enter Canaan, the land that will be allotted to you as an inheritance will have these boundaries:

verses.name: Numbers 34:3
verses.text: "'Your southern side will include some of the Desert of Zin along the border of Edom. On the east, your southern boundary will start from the end of the Salt Sea,

verses.name: Numbers 34:4
verses.text: cross south of Scorpion Pass, continue on to Zin and go south of Kadesh Barnea. Then it will go to Hazar Addar and over to Azmon,

verses.name: Numbers 34:5
verses.text: where it will turn, join the Wadi of Egypt and end at the Sea.

verses.name: Numbers 34:6
verses.text: "'Your western boundary will be the coast of the Great Sea. This will be your boundary on the west.

verses.name: Numbers 34:7
verses.text: "'For your northern boundary, run a line from the Great Sea to Mount Hor

verses.name: Numbers 34:8
verses.text: and from Mount Hor to Lebo Hamath. Then the boundary will go to Zedad,

verses.name: Numbers 34:9
verses.text: continue to Ziphron and end at Hazar Enan. This will be your boundary on the north.

verses.name: Numbers 34:10
verses.text: "'For your eastern boundary, run a line from Hazar Enan to Shepham.

verses.name: Numbers 34:11
verses.text: The boundary will go down from Shepham to Riblah on the east side of Ain and continue along the slopes east of the Sea of Kinnereth.

verses.name: Numbers 34:12
verses.text: Then the boundary will go down along the Jordan and end at the Salt Sea. "'This will be your land, with its boundaries on every side.'"

verses.name: Numbers 34:13
verses.text: Moses commanded the Israelites: "Assign this land by lot as an inheritance. The LORD has ordered that it be given to the nine and a half tribes,

verses.name: Numbers 34:14
verses.text: because the families of the tribe of Reuben, the tribe of Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh have received their inheritance.

verses.name: Numbers 34:15
verses.text: These two and a half tribes have received their inheritance on the east side of the Jordan of Jericho, toward the sunrise."

verses.name: Numbers 34:16
verses.text: The LORD said to Moses,

verses.name: Numbers 34:17
verses.text: "These are the names of the men who are to assign the land for you as an inheritance: Eleazar the priest and Joshua son of Nun.

verses.name: Numbers 34:18
verses.text: And appoint one leader from each tribe to help assign the land.

verses.name: Numbers 34:19
verses.text: These are their names: Caleb son of Jephunneh, from the tribe of Judah;

verses.name: Numbers 34:20
verses.text: Shemuel son of Ammihud, from the tribe of Simeon;

verses.name: Numbers 34:21
verses.text: Elidad son of Kislon, from the tribe of Benjamin;

verses.name: Numbers 34:22
verses.text: Bukki son of Jogli, the leader from the tribe of Dan;

verses.name: Numbers 34:23
verses.text: Hanniel son of Ephod, the leader from the tribe of Manasseh son of Joseph;

verses.name: Numbers 34:24
verses.text: Kemuel son of Shiphtan, the leader from the tribe of Ephraim son of Joseph;

verses.name: Numbers 34:25
verses.text: Elizaphan son of Parnach, the leader from the tribe of Zebulun;

verses.name: Numbers 34:26
verses.text: Paltiel son of Azzan, the leader from the tribe of Issachar;

verses.name: Numbers 34:27
verses.text: Ahihud son of Shelomi, the leader from the tribe of Asher;

verses.name: Numbers 34:28
verses.text: Pedahel son of Ammihud, the leader from the tribe of Naphtali."

verses.name: Numbers 34:29
verses.text: These are the men the LORD commanded to assign the inheritance to the Israelites in the land of Canaan.

verses.name: Numbers 35:1
verses.text: On the plains of Moab by the Jordan across from Jericho, the LORD said to Moses,

verses.name: Numbers 35:2
verses.text: "Command the Israelites to give the Levites towns to live in from the inheritance the Israelites will possess. And give them pasturelands around the towns.

verses.name: Numbers 35:3
verses.text: Then they will have towns to live in and pasturelands for their cattle, flocks and all their other livestock.

verses.name: Numbers 35:4
verses.text: "The pasturelands around the towns that you give the Levites will extend out fifteen hundred feet from the town wall.

verses.name: Numbers 35:5
verses.text: Outside the town, measure three thousand feet on the east side, three thousand on the south side, three thousand on the west and three thousand on the north, with the town in the center. They will have this area as pastureland for the towns.

verses.name: Numbers 35:6
verses.text: "Six of the towns you give the Levites will be cities of refuge, to which a person who has killed someone may flee. In addition, give them forty-two other towns.

verses.name: Numbers 35:7
verses.text: In all you must give the Levites forty-eight towns, together with their pasturelands.

verses.name: Numbers 35:8
verses.text: The towns you give the Levites from the land the Israelites possess are to be given in proportion to the inheritance of each tribe: Take many towns from a tribe that has many, but few from one that has few."

verses.name: Numbers 35:9
verses.text: Then the LORD said to Moses:

verses.name: Numbers 35:10
verses.text: "Speak to the Israelites and say to them: 'When you cross the Jordan into Canaan,

verses.name: Numbers 35:11
verses.text: select some towns to be your cities of refuge, to which a person who has killed someone accidentally may flee.

verses.name: Numbers 35:12
verses.text: They will be places of refuge from the avenger, so that a person accused of murder may not die before he stands trial before the assembly.

verses.name: Numbers 35:13
verses.text: These six towns you give will be your cities of refuge.

verses.name: Numbers 35:14
verses.text: Give three on this side of the Jordan and three in Canaan as cities of refuge.

verses.name: Numbers 35:15
verses.text: These six towns will be a place of refuge for Israelites, aliens and any other people living among them, so that anyone who has killed another accidentally can flee there.

verses.name: Numbers 35:16
verses.text: "'If a man strikes someone with an iron object so that he dies, he is a murderer; the murderer shall be put to death.

verses.name: Numbers 35:17
verses.text: Or if anyone has a stone in his hand that could kill, and he strikes someone so that he dies, he is a murderer; the murderer shall be put to death.

verses.name: Numbers 35:18
verses.text: Or if anyone has a wooden object in his hand that could kill, and he hits someone so that he dies, he is a murderer; the murderer shall be put to death.

verses.name: Numbers 35:19
verses.text: The avenger of blood shall put the murderer to death; when he meets him, he shall put him to death.

verses.name: Numbers 35:20
verses.text: If anyone with malice aforethought shoves another or throws something at him intentionally so that he dies

verses.name: Numbers 35:21
verses.text: or if in hostility he hits him with his fist so that he dies, that person shall be put to death; he is a murderer. The avenger of blood shall put the murderer to death when he meets him.

verses.name: Numbers 35:22
verses.text: "'But if without hostility someone suddenly shoves another or throws something at him unintentionally

verses.name: Numbers 35:23
verses.text: or, without seeing him, drops a stone on him that could kill him, and he dies, then since he was not his enemy and he did not intend to harm him,

verses.name: Numbers 35:24
verses.text: the assembly must judge between him and the avenger of blood according to these regulations.

verses.name: Numbers 35:25
verses.text: The assembly must protect the one accused of murder from the avenger of blood and send him back to the city of refuge to which he fled. He must stay there until the death of the high priest, who was anointed with the holy oil.

verses.name: Numbers 35:26
verses.text: "'But if the accused ever goes outside the limits of the city of refuge to which he has fled

verses.name: Numbers 35:27
verses.text: and the avenger of blood finds him outside the city, the avenger of blood may kill the accused without being guilty of murder.

verses.name: Numbers 35:28
verses.text: The accused must stay in his city of refuge until the death of the high priest; only after the death of the high priest may he return to his own property.

verses.name: Numbers 35:29
verses.text: "'These are to be legal requirements for you throughout the generations to come, wherever you live.

verses.name: Numbers 35:30
verses.text: "'Anyone who kills a person is to be put to death as a murderer only on the testimony of witnesses. But no one is to be put to death on the testimony of only one witness.

verses.name: Numbers 35:31
verses.text: "'Do not accept a ransom for the life of a murderer, who deserves to die. He must surely be put to death.

verses.name: Numbers 35:32
verses.text: "'Do not accept a ransom for anyone who has fled to a city of refuge and so allow him to go back and live on his own land before the death of the high priest.

verses.name: Numbers 35:33
verses.text: "'Do not pollute the land where you are. Bloodshed pollutes the land, and atonement cannot be made for the land on which blood has been shed, except by the blood of the one who shed it.

verses.name: Numbers 35:34
verses.text: Do not defile the land where you live and where I dwell, for I, the LORD, dwell among the Israelites.'"

verses.name: Numbers 36:1
verses.text: The family heads of the clan of Gilead son of Makir, the son of Manasseh, who were from the clans of the descendants of Joseph, came and spoke before Moses and the leaders, the heads of the Israelite families.

verses.name: Numbers 36:2
verses.text: They said, "When the LORD commanded my lord to give the land as an inheritance to the Israelites by lot, he ordered you to give the inheritance of our brother Zelophehad to his daughters.

verses.name: Numbers 36:3
verses.text: Now suppose they marry men from other Israelite tribes; then their inheritance will be taken from our ancestral inheritance and added to that of the tribe they marry into. And so part of the inheritance allotted to us will be taken away.

verses.name: Numbers 36:4
verses.text: When the Year of Jubilee for the Israelites comes, their inheritance will be added to that of the tribe into which they marry, and their property will be taken from the tribal inheritance of our forefathers."

verses.name: Numbers 36:5
verses.text: Then at the LORD's command Moses gave this order to the Israelites: "What the tribe of the descendants of Joseph is saying is right.

verses.name: Numbers 36:6
verses.text: This is what the LORD commands for Zelophehad's daughters: They may marry anyone they please as long as they marry within the tribal clan of their father.

verses.name: Numbers 36:7
verses.text: No inheritance in Israel is to pass from tribe to tribe, for every Israelite shall keep the tribal land inherited from his forefathers.

verses.name: Numbers 36:8
verses.text: Every daughter who inherits land in any Israelite tribe must marry someone in her father's tribal clan, so that every Israelite will possess the inheritance of his fathers.

verses.name: Numbers 36:9
verses.text: No inheritance may pass from tribe to tribe, for each Israelite tribe is to keep the land it inherits."

verses.name: Numbers 36:10
verses.text: So Zelophehad's daughters did as the LORD commanded Moses.

verses.name: Numbers 36:11
verses.text: Zelophehad's daughters-Mahlah, Tirzah, Hoglah, Milcah and Noah-married their cousins on their father's side.

verses.name: Numbers 36:12
verses.text: They married within the clans of the descendants of Manasseh son of Joseph, and their inheritance remained in their father's clan and tribe.

verses.name: Numbers 36:13
verses.text: These are the commands and regulations the LORD gave through Moses to the Israelites on the plains of Moab by the Jordan across from Jericho.
